class.help:
The Physics Manager is responsible for looking after all of the running physics systems.
Phaser supports 3 physics systems: Arcade Physics, P2 and Ninja Physics (with Box2D and Chipmunk in development)
Game Objects can belong to only 1 physics system, but you can have multiple systems active in a single game.

For example you could have P2 managing a polygon-built terrain landscape that an vehicle drives over, while it could be firing bullets that use the
faster (due to being much simpler) Arcade Physics system.

parameters.name: game
parameters.help: A reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: physicsConfig
parameters.help: A physics configuration object to pass to the Physics world on creation.

parameters.help: The game object to create the physics body on. Can also be an array of objects, a body will be created on every object in the array.

parameters.name: system
parameters.help: The physics system that will be used to create the body. Defaults to Arcade Physics.

parameters.name: debug
parameters.help: Enable the debug drawing for this body. Defaults to false.

public.help:
This will create a default physics body on the given game object or array of objects.
A game object can only have 1 physics body active at any one time, and it can't be changed until the object is destroyed.
It can be for any of the physics systems that have been started:

Phaser.Physics.Arcade - A light weight AABB based collision system with basic separation.
Phaser.Physics.P2JS - A full-body advanced physics system supporting multiple object shapes, polygon loading, contact materials, springs and constraints.
Phaser.Physics.NINJA - A port of Metanet Softwares N+ physics system. Advanced AABB and Circle vs. Tile collision.
Phaser.Physics.BOX2D - A port of https://code.google.com/p/box2d-html5
Phaser.Physics.CHIPMUNK is still in development.

If you require more control over what type of body is created, for example to create a Ninja Physics Circle instead of the default AABB, then see the
individual physics systems `enable` methods instead of using this generic one.

public.name: parseConfig
public.help: Parses the Physics Configuration object passed to the Game constructor and starts any physics systems specified within.

public.name: startSystem

parameters.name: The
parameters.help: physics system to start.

public.help:
This will create an instance of the requested physics simulation.
Phaser.Physics.Arcade is running by default, but all others need activating directly.
You can start the following physics systems:
Phaser.Physics.P2JS - A full-body advanced physics system by Stefan Hedman.
Phaser.Physics.NINJA - A port of Metanet Softwares N+ physics system.
Phaser.Physics.BOX2D and Phaser.Physics.CHIPMUNK are still in development.

public.name: acceleration
public.inlineHelp: The velocity in pixels per second sq. of the Body.

public.name: allowGravity
public.inlineHelp: Allow this Body to be influenced by gravity? Either world or local.

public.name: allowRotation
public.inlineHelp: Allow this Body to be rotated? (via angularVelocity, etc)

public.name: angle
public.inlineHelp: The angle of the Body in radians as calculated by its velocity, rather than its visual angle.

public.name: angularAcceleration
public.inlineHelp: The angular acceleration in pixels per second sq. of the Body.

public.name: angularDrag
public.inlineHelp: The angular drag applied to the rotation of the Body.

public.name: angularVelocity
public.inlineHelp: The angular velocity in pixels per second sq. of the Body.

public.name: blocked
public.inlineHelp: An object containing on which faces this Body is blocked from moving, if any.
public.help: This object is populated with boolean values when the Body collides with the World bounds or a Tile.\nFor example if blocked.up is true then the Body cannot move up.

public.name: bottom
public.inlineHelp: The bottom value of this Body (same as Body.y + Body.height)

public.name: bounce
public.inlineHelp: The elasticitiy of the Body when colliding. bounce.x/y = 1 means full rebound, bounce.x/y = 0.5 means 50% rebound velocity.

public.name: center
public.inlineHelp: The center coordinate of the Physics Body.

public.name: checkCollision
public.inlineHelp: An object containing allowed collision.
public.help: Set the checkCollision properties to control which directions collision is processed for this Body.\nFor example checkCollision.up = false means it won't collide when the collision happened while moving up.

public.name: collideWorldBounds
public.inlineHelp: Should the Body collide with the World bounds?
public.help: A Body can be set to collide against the World bounds automatically and rebound back into the World if this is set to true. Otherwise it will leave the World.

public.name: customSeparateX
public.inlineHelp: Use a custom separation system or the built-in one?
public.help: This flag allows you to disable the custom x separation that takes place by Physics.Arcade.separate.\nUsed in combination with your own collision processHandler you can create whatever type of collision response you need.

public.name: customSeparateY
public.inlineHelp: Use a custom separation system or the built-in one?
public.help: This flag allows you to disable the custom y separation that takes place by Physics.Arcade.separate.\nUsed in combination with your own collision processHandler you can create whatever type of collision response you need.

public.name: deltaMax
public.inlineHelp: The Sprite position is updated based on the delta x/y values. You can set a cap on those (both +-) using deltaMax.

public.name: drag
public.inlineHelp: The drag applied to the motion of the Body.

public.name: embedded
public.inlineHelp: Body embed value.
public.help: If a body is overlapping with another body, but neither of them are moving (maybe they spawned on-top of each other?) this is set to true.

public.name: enable
public.inlineHelp: A disabled body won't be checked for any form of collision or overlap or have its pre/post updates run.

public.name: facing
public.inlineHelp: A const reference to the direction the Body is traveling or facing.

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: Local reference to game.

public.name: gravity
public.inlineHelp: A local gravity applied to this Body. If non-zero this over rides any world gravity, unless Body.allowGravity is set to false.

public.name: halfHeight
public.inlineHelp: The calculated height / 2 of the physics body.

public.name: halfWidth
public.inlineHelp: The calculated width / 2 of the physics body.

public.name: immovable
public.inlineHelp: An immovable Body will not receive any impacts from other bodies.

public.name: mass
public.inlineHelp: The mass of the Body.

public.name: maxAngular
public.inlineHelp: The maximum angular velocity in pixels per second sq. that the Body can reach.

public.name: maxVelocity
public.inlineHelp: The maximum velocity in pixels per second sq. that the Body can reach.

public.name: moves
public.inlineHelp: Set to true to allow the Physics system to move this Body, other false to move it manually.
public.help: If you have a Body that is being moved around the world via a tween or a Group motion, but its local x/y position never\nactually changes, then you should set Body.moves = false. Otherwise it will most likely fly off the screen.\nIf you want the physics system to move the body around, then set moves to true.

public.name: newVelocity
public.inlineHelp: New velocity.

public.name: offset
public.inlineHelp: The offset of the Physics Body from the Sprite x/y position.

public.name: overlapX
public.inlineHelp: The amount of horizontal overlap during the collision.
public.help: When this body collides with another, the amount of overlap is stored here.

public.name: overlapY
public.inlineHelp: The amount of vertical overlap during the collision.
public.help: When this body collides with another, the amount of overlap is stored here.

public.name: phaser
public.inlineHelp: Is this Body in a preUpdate (1) or postUpdate (2) state?

public.name: position
public.inlineHelp: The position of the physics body.

public.name: preRotation
public.inlineHelp: The previous rotation of the physics body.

public.name: prev
public.inlineHelp: The previous position of the physics body.

public.name: right
public.inlineHelp: The right value of this Body (same as Body.x + Body.width)

public.name: rotation
public.inlineHelp: The amount the Body is rotated.

public.name: skipQuadTree
public.inlineHelp: If true and you collide this Sprite against a Group, it will disable the collision check from using a QuadTree.

public.name: sourceHeight
public.inlineHelp: The un-scaled original size.

public.name: sourceWidth
public.inlineHelp: The un-scaled original size.

public.name: speed
public.inlineHelp: The speed of the Body as calculated by its velocity.

public.name: sprite
public.inlineHelp: Reference to the parent Sprite.

public.name: tilePadding
public.inlineHelp: Extra padding to be added to this sprites dimensions when checking for tile collision.
public.help: If this is an especially small or fast moving object then it can sometimes skip over tilemap collisions if it moves through a tile in a step.\nSet this padding value to add extra padding to its bounds. tilePadding.x applied to its width, y to its height.

public.name: touching
public.inlineHelp: An object containing touching results.
public.help: This object is populated with boolean values when the Body collides with another.\ntouching.up = true means the collision happened to the top of this Body for example.

public.name: type
public.inlineHelp: The type of physics system this body belongs to.

public.name: velocity
public.inlineHelp: The velocity in pixels per second sq. of the Body.

public.name: wasTouching
public.inlineHelp: An object containing previous touching results.
public.help: This object is populated with previous touching values from the bodies previous collision.

public.name: width
public.inlineHelp: The calculated width of the physics body.

public.inlineHelp: The x position.

public.inlineHelp: The y position.

class.help: The Physics Body is linked to a single Sprite. All physics operations should be performed against the body rather than\nthe Sprite itself. For example you can set the velocity, acceleration, bounce values etc all on the Body.

class.help:
Ninja Physics Tile constructor.
A Tile is defined by its width, height and type. It's type can include slope data, such as 45 degree slopes, or convex slopes.
Understand that for any type including a slope (types 2 to 29) the Tile must be SQUARE, i.e. have an equal width and height.
Also note that as Tiles are primarily used for levels they have gravity disabled and world bounds collision disabled by default.

Note: This class could be massively optimised and reduced in size. I leave that challenge up to you.

public.name: justPressed

parameters.name: duration
parameters.help: The time to check against. If none given it will use InputManager.justPressedRate.

returns.help: true if the Pointer was pressed down within the duration given.

public.help: The Pointer is considered justPressed if the time it was pressed onto the touchscreen or clicked is less than justPressedRate.\nNote that calling justPressed doesn't reset the pressed status of the Pointer, it will return `true` for as long as the duration is valid.\nIf you wish to check if the Pointer was pressed down just once then see the Sprite.events.onInputDown event.

public.name: justReleased

parameters.name: duration
parameters.help: The time to check against. If none given it will use InputManager.justReleasedRate.

returns.help: true if the Pointer was released within the duration given.

public.help: The Pointer is considered justReleased if the time it left the touchscreen is less than justReleasedRate.\nNote that calling justReleased doesn't reset the pressed status of the Pointer, it will return `true` for as long as the duration is valid.\nIf you wish to check if the Pointer was released just once then see the Sprite.events.onInputUp event.

public.name: buttonMode
public.help: This is used to indicate if the displayObject should display a mouse hand cursor on rollover

public.name: cacheAsBitmap
public.help: Set if this display object is cached as a bitmap.\nThis basically takes a snap shot of the display object as it is at that moment. It can provide a performance benefit for complex static displayObjects.\nTo remove simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: cameraOffset
public.inlineHelp: If this object is fixedToCamera then this stores the x/y offset that its drawn at, from the top-left of the camera view.

public.name: children

public.name: classType

public.name: cursor
public.inlineHelp: The current display object that the Group cursor is pointing to.
public.help: The cursor is a simple way to iterate through the objects in a Group using the Group.next and Group.previous functions.\nThe cursor is set to the first child added to the Group and doesn't change unless you call next, previous or set it directly with Group.cursor.

public.name: defaultCursor
public.help: This is the cursor that will be used when the mouse is over this object. To enable this the element must have interaction = true and buttonMode = true\n

public.name: enableBody
public.inlineHelp: If true all Sprites created by, or added to this Group, will have a physics body enabled on them. Change the body type with `Group.physicsBodyType`.

public.name: enableBodyDebug
public.inlineHelp: If true when a physics body is created (via Group.enableBody) it will create a physics debug object as well. Only works for P2 bodies.

public.name: exists
public.inlineHelp: If exists is true the Group is updated, otherwise it is skipped.

public.name: filterArea
public.help: The area the filter is applied to like the hitArea this is used as more of an optimisation\nrather than figuring out the dimensions of the displayObject each frame you can set this rectangle

public.name: filters
public.help: Sets the filters for the displayObject.\n* IMPORTANT: This is a webGL only feature and will be ignored by the canvas renderer.\nTo remove filters simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: fixedToCamera
public.inlineHelp: Set to true to fix this Group to the Camera at its current world coordinates.
public.help: A Group that is fixed to the camera uses its x/y coordinates as offsets from the top left of the camera. These are stored in Group.cameraOffset.\nNote that the cameraOffset values are in addition to any parent in the display list.\nSo if this Group was in a Group that has x: 200, then this will be added to the cameraOffset.x

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the currently running Game.

public.name: height
public.help: The height of the displayObjectContainer, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

public.name: hitArea
public.help: This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default.\nSetting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)

public.name: ignoreDestroy
public.inlineHelp: A Group with `ignoreDestroy` set to `true` ignores all calls to its `destroy` method.

public.name: interactive
public.help: Indicates if the sprite will have touch and mouse interactivity. It is false by default

public.name: length
public.inlineHelp: The total number of children in this Group, regardless of their exists/alive status.

public.name: mask
public.help: Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it.\nIn PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping.\nTo remove a mask, set this property to null.

public.name: name
public.inlineHelp: A name for this Group. Not used internally but useful for debugging.

public.name: onDestroy
public.inlineHelp: This signal is dispatched when the parent is destoyed.

public.name: parent
public.inlineHelp: The parent of this Group.

public.name: physicsBodyType
public.inlineHelp: If Group.enableBody is true this is the type of physics body that is created on new Sprites. Phaser.Physics.ARCADE, Phaser.Physics.P2, Phaser.Physics.NINJA, etc.

public.name: pivot
public.inlineHelp: The pivot point of the Group container.

public.name: position
public.help: The coordinate of the object relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

public.name: renderable
public.help: Can this object be rendered

public.name: rotation
public.inlineHelp: The angle of rotation given in radians.
public.help: The angle of rotation of the Group container. This will adjust the Group container itself by modifying its rotation.\nThis will have no impact on the rotation value of its children, but it will update their worldTransform and on-screen position.

public.name: scale
public.inlineHelp: The scale of the Group container.

public.name: stage
public.help: [read-only] The stage the display object is connected to, or undefined if it is not connected to the stage.

public.name: total
public.inlineHelp: The total number of children in this Group who have a state of exists = true.

public.name: visible
public.inlineHelp: The visible state of the Group. Non-visible Groups and all of their children are not rendered.

public.name: width
public.help: The width of the displayObjectContainer, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

public.name: worldAlpha
public.help: [read-only] The multiplied alpha of the displayObject

public.name: worldVisible
public.help: [read-only] Indicates if the sprite is globally visible.

public.name: x
public.inlineHelp: The x coordinate of the Group container.
public.help: The x coordinate of the Group container. You can adjust the Group container itself by modifying its coordinates.\nThis will have no impact on the x/y coordinates of its children, but it will update their worldTransform and on-screen position.

public.name: y
public.inlineHelp: The y coordinate of the Group container.
public.help: The y coordinate of the Group container. You can adjust the Group container itself by modifying its coordinates.\nThis will have no impact on the x/y coordinates of its children, but it will update their worldTransform and on-screen position.

public.name: z
public.inlineHelp: The z-depth value of this object within its Group (remember the World is a Group as well). No two objects in a Group can have the same z value.

class.help:
The SpriteBatch class is a really fast version of the DisplayObjectContainer built purely for speed, so use when you need a lot of sprites or particles.
It's worth mentioning that by default sprite batches are used through-out the renderer, so you only really need to use a SpriteBatch if you have over
1000 sprites that all share the same texture (or texture atlas). It's also useful if running in Canvas mode and you have a lot of un-rotated or un-scaled
Sprites as it skips all of the Canvas setTransform calls, which helps performance, especially on mobile devices.

parameters.name: game
parameters.help: A reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.help: The parent Group, DisplayObject or DisplayObjectContainer that this Group will be added to. If `undefined` or `null` it will use game.world.

parameters.name: name
parameters.help: A name for this Group. Not used internally but useful for debugging.

parameters.name: addToStage
parameters.help: If set to true this Group will be added directly to the Game.Stage instead of Game.World.

class.name: Phaser.SpriteBatch

public.name: add

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: An instance of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the child will not dispatch the onAddedToGroup event.

returns.help: The child that was added to the Group.

public.help: Adds an existing object to this Group. The object can be an instance of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object.\nThe child is automatically added to the top of the Group, so renders on-top of everything else within the Group. If you need to control\nthat then see the addAt method.

public.name: addAll

parameters.name: property
parameters.help: The property to increment, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.help: The amount to increment the property by. If child.x = 10 then addAll('x', 40) would make child.x = 50.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

public.help: Adds the amount to the given property on all children in this Group.\nGroup.addAll('x', 10) will add 10 to the child.x value.

public.name: addAt

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: An instance of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object..

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index within the Group to insert the child to.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the child will not dispatch the onAddedToGroup event.

returns.help: The child that was added to the Group.

public.help: Adds an existing object to this Group. The object can be an instance of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object.\nThe child is added to the Group at the location specified by the index value, this allows you to control child ordering.

public.name: addChild

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The DisplayObject to add to the container

returns.help: The child that was added.

public.help: Adds a child to the container.

public.name: addChildAt

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to add

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index to place the child in

returns.help: The child that was added.

public.help: Adds a child to the container at a specified index. If the index is out of bounds an error will be thrown

public.name: addMultiple

parameters.name: children
parameters.help: An array containing instances of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the children will not dispatch the onAddedToGroup event.

returns.help: The array of children that were added to the Group.

public.help: Adds an array existing objects to this Group. The objects can be instances of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object.\nThe children are automatically added to the top of the Group, so render on-top of everything else within the Group.\nTODO: Add ability to pass the children as parameters rather than having to be an array.

public.name: ascendingSortHandler

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The first object being sorted.

parameters.name: b
parameters.help: The second object being sorted.

public.help: An internal helper function for the sort process.

public.name: bringToTop

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to bring to the top of this Group.

returns.help: The child that was moved.

public.help: Brings the given child to the top of this Group so it renders above all other children.

public.name: callAll

parameters.name: method
parameters.help: A string containing the name of the function that will be called. The function must exist on the child.

parameters.name: context
parameters.help: A string containing the context under which the method will be executed. Set to null to default to the child.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.help: Additional parameters that will be passed to the method.

public.help: Calls a function on all of the children regardless if they are dead or alive (see callAllExists if you need control over that)\nAfter the method parameter and context you can add as many extra parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child.

public.name: callAllExists

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that exists on the children that will be called.

parameters.name: existsValue
parameters.help: Only children with exists=existsValue will be called.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.help: Additional parameters that will be passed to the callback.

public.help: Calls a function on all of the children that have exists=true in this Group.\nAfter the existsValue parameter you can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child callback.

public.name: checkAll

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be checked.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If set then only children with alive=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If set then only children with visible=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.

public.help: This function allows you to quickly check that the same property across all children of this Group is equal to the given value.\nThis call doesn't descend down children, so if you have a Group inside of this Group, the property will be checked on the Group but not its children.

public.name: checkProperty

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to check the property value on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: An array of strings that make up the property that will be set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be checked.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.

returns.help: True if the property was was equal to value, false if not.

public.help: Checks a property for the given value on the child.

public.name: click
public.help: A callback that is used when the users clicks on the displayObject with their mouse's left button

public.name: countDead

returns.help: The number of children flagged as dead.

public.help: Call this function to find out how many members of the group are dead.

public.name: countLiving

returns.help: The number of children flagged as alive.

public.help: Call this function to find out how many members of the group are alive.

public.name: create

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: The x coordinate to display the newly created Sprite at. The value is in relation to the Group.x point.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The y coordinate to display the newly created Sprite at. The value is in relation to the Group.y point.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.help: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.

parameters.name: exists
parameters.help: The default exists state of the Sprite.

returns.help: The child that was created. Will be a Phaser.Sprite unless Group.classType has been changed.

public.help: Automatically creates a new Phaser.Sprite object and adds it to the top of this Group.\nYou can change Group.classType to any object and this call will create an object of that type instead, but it should extend either Sprite or Image.

public.name: createMultiple

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.help: The number of Sprites to create.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.help: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.

parameters.name: exists
parameters.help: The default exists state of the Sprite.

public.help:
Automatically creates multiple Phaser.Sprite objects and adds them to the top of this Group.
Useful if you need to quickly generate a pool of identical sprites, such as bullets. By default the sprites will be set to not exist
and will be positioned at 0, 0 (relative to the Group.x/y)
You can change Group.classType to any object and this call will create an object of that type instead, but it should extend either Sprite or Image.

public.name: customSort

parameters.name: sortHandler
parameters.help: Your sort handler function. It will be sent two parameters: the two children involved in the comparison. It must return -1, 1 or 0.

parameters.name: context
parameters.help: The scope in which the sortHandler is called.

public.help: This allows you to use your own sort handler function.\nIt will be sent two parameters: the two children involved in the comparison (a and b). It should return -1 if a > b, 1 if a < b or 0 if a === b.

public.name: descendingSortHandler

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The first object being sorted.

parameters.name: b
parameters.help: The second object being sorted.

public.help: An internal helper function for the sort process.

parameters.name: destroyChildren
parameters.help: Should every child of this Group have its destroy method called?

parameters.name: soft
parameters.help: A 'soft destroy' (set to true) doesn't remove this Group from its parent or null the game reference. Set to false and it does.

public.help: Destroys this Group. Removes all children, then removes the container from the display list and nulls references.

public.name: divideAll

parameters.name: property
parameters.help: The property to divide, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.help: The amount to divide the property by. If child.x = 100 then divideAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 50.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

public.name: filter

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.help: The function that each child will be evaluated against. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter, the index as the second, and the entire child array as the third

parameters.name: checkExists
parameters.help: If set only children with exists=true will be passed to the callback, otherwise all children will be passed.

returns.help: Returns an array list containing all the children that the predicate returned true for

public.name: forEach

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that will be called. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

parameters.name: checkExists
parameters.help: If set only children with exists=true will be passed to the callback, otherwise all children will be passed.

public.help:
Allows you to call your own function on each member of this Group. You must pass the callback and context in which it will run.
After the checkExists parameter you can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child.
For example: Group.forEach(awardBonusGold, this, true, 100, 500)
Note: Currently this will skip any children which are Groups themselves.

public.name: forEachAlive

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that will be called. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

public.help: Allows you to call your own function on each alive member of this Group (where child.alive=true). You must pass the callback and context in which it will run.\nYou can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child.\nFor example: Group.forEachAlive(causeDamage, this, 500)

public.name: forEachDead

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that will be called. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

public.help: Allows you to call your own function on each dead member of this Group (where alive=false). You must pass the callback and context in which it will run.\nYou can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child.\nFor example: Group.forEachDead(bringToLife, this)

public.name: forEachExists

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that will be called. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

public.help: Allows you to call your own function on each member of this Group where child.exists=true. You must pass the callback and context in which it will run.\nYou can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child.\nFor example: Group.forEachExists(causeDamage, this, 500)

parameters.name: state

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to get the index for.

returns.help: The index of the child or -1 if it's not a member of this Group.

public.name: getLocalBounds

returns.help: The rectangular bounding area

public.help: Retrieves the non-global local bounds of the displayObjectContainer as a rectangle. The calculation takes all visible children into consideration.

parameters.name: startIndex

parameters.name: length
parameters.help: Optional restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.

returns.help: A random child of this Group.

public.help: Returns a member at random from the group.

public.name: getTop

returns.help: The child at the top of the Group.

public.help: Returns the child at the top of this Group. The top is the one being displayed (rendered) above every other child.

public.name: hasProperty

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to check for the existance of the property on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: An array of strings that make up the property.

returns.help: True if the child has the property, otherwise false.

public.name: iterate

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The child property to check, i.e. 'exists', 'alive', 'health'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: If child.key === this value it will be considered a match. Note that a strict comparison is used.

parameters.name: returnType
parameters.help: How to return the data from this method. Either Phaser.Group.RETURN_NONE, Phaser.Group.RETURN_TOTAL or Phaser.Group.RETURN_CHILD.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: Optional function that will be called on each matching child. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

returns.help: Returns either a numeric total (if RETURN_TOTAL was specified) or the child object.

public.help: Iterates over the children of the Group. When a child has a property matching key that equals the given value, it is considered as a match.\nMatched children can be sent to the optional callback, or simply returned or counted.\nYou can add as many callback parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child, after the callbackContext parameter.

public.name: mousedown
public.help: A callback that is used when the user clicks the mouse's left button down over the sprite

public.name: mouseover

public.name: mouseup

public.name: mouseupoutside
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's left button that was over the displayObject but is no longer over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired, the mouse's left button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

public.name: next

public.name: previous

parameters.name: destroy

parameters.name: silent

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the children will not dispatch their onRemovedFromGroup events.

public.help: Removes all children from this Group whos index falls beteen the given startIndex and endIndex values.

parameters.help: The DisplayObject to remove

returns.help: The child that was removed.

public.name: removeChildAt

public.name: removeChildren

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.help: The ending position. Default value is size of the container.

public.name: removeStageReference
public.help: Removes the current stage reference from the container and all of its children.

public.name: replace

parameters.name: oldChild
parameters.help: The child in this Group that will be replaced.

parameters.name: newChild
parameters.help: The child to be inserted into this Group.

returns.help: Returns the oldChild that was replaced within this Group.

public.name: resetCursor

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: Set the cursor to point to a specific index.

returns.help: The child the cursor now points to.

public.help: Sets the Group cursor to the first object in the Group. If the optional index parameter is given it sets the cursor to the object at that index instead.

public.name: reverse
public.help: Reverses all children in this Group. Note that this does not propagate, only direct children are re-ordered.

public.name: rightclick
public.help: A callback that is used when the users clicks on the displayObject with their mouse's right button

public.name: rightdown
public.help: A callback that is used when the user clicks the mouse's right button down over the sprite

public.name: rightup
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's right button that was over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired the mouse's right button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's right button that was over the displayObject but is no longer over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired, the mouse's right button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

public.name: sendToBack

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to send to the bottom of this Group.

returns.help: The child that was moved.

public.name: set

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to set the property on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If set then the child will only be updated if alive=true.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If set then the child will only be updated if visible=true.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.help: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

returns.help: True if the property was set, false if not.

public.help: This function allows you to quickly set a property on a single child of this Group to a new value.\nThe operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

public.name: setAll

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If set then only children with alive=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If set then only children with visible=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.help: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

public.help:
This function allows you to quickly set the same property across all children of this Group to a new value.
This call doesn't descend down children, so if you have a Group inside of this Group, the property will be set on the Group but not its children.
If you need that ability please see `Group.setAllChildren`.

The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

public.name: setAllChildren

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If set then only children with alive=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If set then only children with visible=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.help: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

public.help:
This function allows you to quickly set the same property across all children of this Group, and any child Groups, to a new value.

If this Group contains other Groups then the same property is set across their children as well, iterating down until it reaches the bottom.
Unlike with Group.setAll the property is NOT set on child Groups itself.

The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

public.name: setChildIndex

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child DisplayObject instance for which you want to change the index number

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The resulting index number for the child display object

public.help: Changes the position of an existing child in the display object container

public.name: setProperty

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to set the property value on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: An array of strings that make up the property that will be set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.help: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

returns.help: True if the property was set, false if not.

public.help:
Sets a property to the given value on the child. The operation parameter controls how the value is set.
Operation 0 means set the existing value to the given value, or if force is `false` create a new property with the given value.
1 will add the given value to the value already present.
2 will subtract the given value from the value already present.
3 will multiply the value already present by the given value.
4 will divide the value already present by the given value.

parameters.name: order
parameters.help: The `Group` constant that defines the sort order. Possible values are Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING and Phaser.Group.SORT_DESCENDING.

public.help: Call this function to sort the group according to a particular value and order.\nFor example to depth sort Sprites for Zelda-style game you might call `group.sort('y', Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING)` at the bottom of your `State.update()`.

parameters.name: checkAlive

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

public.help: Subtracts the amount from the given property on all children in this Group.\nGroup.subAll('x', 10) will minus 10 from the child.x value.

public.name: hitArea
public.help: This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default.\nSetting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)

public.name: interactive
public.help: Indicates if the sprite will have touch and mouse interactivity. It is false by default

public.name: mask
public.help: Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it.\nIn PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping.\nTo remove a mask, set this property to null.

A BitmapText object will create a line or multiple lines of text using bitmap font. To split a line you can use '

' in your string.
You can generate the fnt files using
http://www.angelcode.com/products/bmfont/ for windows or
http://www.bmglyph.com/ for mac.

public.name: clearBeforeRender
public.help:
This sets if the WebGLRenderer will clear the context texture or not before the new render pass. If true:
If the Stage is NOT transparent, Pixi will clear to alpha (0, 0, 0, 0).
If the Stage is transparent, Pixi will clear to the target Stage's background color.
Disable this by setting this to false. For example: if your game has a canvas filling background image, you often don't need this set.

class.help:
The WebGLRenderer draws the stage and all its content onto a webGL enabled canvas. This renderer
should be used for browsers that support webGL. This Render works by automatically managing webGLBatchs.
So no need for Sprite Batches or Sprite Clouds.
Don't forget to add the view to your DOM or you will not see anything :)

parameters.help: the canvas to use as a view, optional

parameters.name: [options.transparent=false]
parameters.help: If the render view is transparent, default false

parameters.name: [options.antialias=false]
parameters.help: sets antialias (only applicable in chrome at the moment)

parameters.name: [options.preserveDrawingBuffer=false]
parameters.help: enables drawing buffer preservation, enable this if you need to call toDataUrl on the webgl context

parameters.name: [options.resolution=1]
parameters.help: the resolution of the renderer retina would be 2

class.help: This is a base State class which can be extended if you are creating your own game.\nIt provides quick access to common functions such as the camera, cache, input, match, sound and more.
class.name: Phaser.State

public.name: create
public.help: create is called once preload has completed, this includes the loading of any assets from the Loader.\nIf you don't have a preload method then create is the first method called in your State.

public.name: loadRender
public.help: loadRender is called during the Loader process. This only happens if you've set one or more assets to load in the preload method.\nThe difference between loadRender and render is that any objects you render in this method you must be sure their assets exist.

public.name: loadUpdate
public.help: loadUpdate is called during the Loader process. This only happens if you've set one or more assets to load in the preload method.

public.name: pauseUpdate
public.help: pauseUpdate is called while the game is paused instead of preUpdate, update and postUpdate.

public.name: paused
public.help: This method will be called if the core game loop is paused.

public.name: preload
public.help: preload is called first. Normally you'd use this to load your game assets (or those needed for the current State)\nYou shouldn't create any objects in this method that require assets that you're also loading in this method, as\nthey won't yet be available.

public.name: render
public.help: Nearly all display objects in Phaser render automatically, you don't need to tell them to render.\nHowever the render method is called AFTER the game renderer and plugins have rendered, so you're able to do any\nfinal post-processing style effects here. Note that this happens before plugins postRender takes place.

public.name: resize
public.help: If your game is set to Scalemode RESIZE then each time the browser resizes it will call this function, passing in the new width and height.

public.name: shutdown
public.help: This method will be called when the State is shutdown (i.e. you switch to another state from this one).

public.name: update
public.help: The update method is left empty for your own use.\nIt is called during the core game loop AFTER debug, physics, plugins and the Stage have had their preUpdate methods called.\nIf is called BEFORE Stage, Tweens, Sounds, Input, Physics, Particles and Plugins have had their postUpdate methods called.

class.help: A Retro Font is similar to a BitmapFont, in that it uses a texture to render the text. However unlike a BitmapFont every character in a RetroFont\nis the same size. This makes it similar to a sprite sheet. You typically find font sheets like this from old 8/16-bit games and demos.

public.help: Updates the x and/or y offset that the font is rendered from. This updates all of the texture frames, so be careful how often it is called.\nNote that the values given for the x and y properties are either ADDED to or SUBTRACTED from (if negative) the existing offsetX/Y values of the characters.\nSo if the current offsetY is 8 and you want it to start rendering from y16 you would call updateOffset(0, 8) to add 8 to the current y offset.

class.help:
The Sound Manager is responsible for playing back audio via either the Legacy HTML Audio tag or via Web Audio if the browser supports it.
Note: On Firefox 25+ on Linux if you have media.gstreamer disabled in about:config then it cannot play back mp3 or m4a files.
The audio file type and the encoding of those files are extremely important. Not all browsers can play all audio formats.
There is a good guide to what's supported here: http://hpr.dogphilosophy.net/test/

public.help:
Starts this sound playing (or restarts it if already doing so) and sets the volume to zero.
Then increases the volume from 0 to 1 over the duration specified.
At the end of the fade Sound.onFadeComplete is dispatched with this Sound object as the first parameter,
and the final volume (1) as the second parameter.

class.help:
The sprite sheet loader is used to load in JSON sprite sheet data
To generate the data you can use http://www.codeandweb.com/texturepacker and publish in the 'JSON' format
There is a free version so thats nice, although the paid version is great value for money.
It is highly recommended to use Sprite sheets (also know as a 'texture atlas') as it means sprites can be batched and drawn together for highly increased rendering speed.
Once the data has been loaded the frames are stored in the PIXI texture cache and can be accessed though PIXI.Texture.fromFrameId() and PIXI.Sprite.fromFrameId()
This loader will load the image file that the Spritesheet points to as well as the data.
When loaded this class will dispatch a 'loaded' event

Sets the acceleration.x/y property on the display object so it will move towards the target at the given speed (in pixels per second sq.)
You must give a maximum speed value, beyond which the display object won't go any faster.
Note: The display object does not continuously track the target. If the target changes location during transit the display object will not modify its course.
Note: The display object doesn't stop moving once it reaches the destination coordinates.

public.name: collide

parameters.name: object1
parameters.help: The first object or array of objects to check. Can be Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Group, Phaser.Particles.Emitter, or Phaser.TilemapLayer.

parameters.name: object2
parameters.help: The second object or array of objects to check. Can be Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Group, Phaser.Particles.Emitter or Phaser.TilemapLayer.

parameters.name: collideCallback
parameters.help: An optional callback function that is called if the objects collide. The two objects will be passed to this function in the same order in which you specified them, unless you are colliding Group vs. Sprite, in which case Sprite will always be the first parameter.

parameters.name: processCallback
parameters.help: A callback function that lets you perform additional checks against the two objects if they overlap. If this is set then collision will only happen if processCallback returns true. The two objects will be passed to this function in the same order in which you specified them.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which to run the callbacks.

returns.help: True if a collision occured otherwise false.

public.help:
Checks for collision between two game objects. You can perform Sprite vs. Sprite, Sprite vs. Group, Group vs. Group, Sprite vs. Tilemap Layer or Group vs. Tilemap Layer collisions.
Both the first and second parameter can be arrays of objects, of differing types.
If two arrays are passed, the contents of the first parameter will be tested against all contents of the 2nd parameter.
The objects are also automatically separated. If you don't require separation then use ArcadePhysics.overlap instead.
An optional processCallback can be provided. If given this function will be called when two sprites are found to be colliding. It is called before any separation takes place,
giving you the chance to perform additional checks. If the function returns true then the collision and separation is carried out. If it returns false it is skipped.
The collideCallback is an optional function that is only called if two sprites collide. If a processCallback has been set then it needs to return true for collideCallback to be called.
NOTE: This function is not recursive, and will not test against children of objects passed (i.e. Groups or Tilemaps within other Groups).

If no Pointer is given the Input.activePointer is used.\nThe calculation is made from the display objects x/y coordinate. This may be the top-left if its anchor hasn't been changed.\nIf you need to calculate from the center of a display object instead use the method distanceBetweenCenters()

public.name: moveToObject

parameters.name: displayObject
parameters.help: The display object to move.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.help: The display object to move towards. Can be any object but must have visible x/y properties.

parameters.name: speed
parameters.help: The speed it will move, in pixels per second (default is 60 pixels/sec)

parameters.name: maxTime
parameters.help: Time given in milliseconds (1000 = 1 sec). If set the speed is adjusted so the object will arrive at destination in the given number of ms.

returns.help: The angle (in radians) that the object should be visually set to in order to match its new velocity.

public.help:
Move the given display object towards the destination object at a steady velocity.
If you specify a maxTime then it will adjust the speed (overwriting what you set) so it arrives at the destination in that number of seconds.
Timings are approximate due to the way browser timers work. Allow for a variance of +- 50ms.
Note: The display object does not continuously track the target. If the target changes location during transit the display object will not modify its course.
Note: The display object doesn't stop moving once it reaches the destination coordinates.
Note: Doesn't take into account acceleration, maxVelocity or drag (if you've set drag or acceleration too high this object may not move at all)

Move the given display object towards the pointer at a steady velocity. If no pointer is given it will use Phaser.Input.activePointer.
If you specify a maxTime then it will adjust the speed (over-writing what you set) so it arrives at the destination in that number of seconds.
Timings are approximate due to the way browser timers work. Allow for a variance of +- 50ms.
Note: The display object does not continuously track the target. If the target changes location during transit the display object will not modify its course.
Note: The display object doesn't stop moving once it reaches the destination coordinates.

Move the given display object towards the x/y coordinates at a steady velocity.
If you specify a maxTime then it will adjust the speed (over-writing what you set) so it arrives at the destination in that number of seconds.

public.name: overlap

parameters.name: object1
parameters.help: The first object or array of objects to check. Can be Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Group or Phaser.Particles.Emitter.

parameters.name: object2
parameters.help: The second object or array of objects to check. Can be Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Group or Phaser.Particles.Emitter.

parameters.name: overlapCallback
parameters.help: An optional callback function that is called if the objects overlap. The two objects will be passed to this function in the same order in which you specified them.

parameters.name: processCallback
parameters.help: A callback function that lets you perform additional checks against the two objects if they overlap. If this is set then overlapCallback will only be called if processCallback returns true.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which to run the callbacks.

returns.help: True if an overlap occurred otherwise false.

public.help:
Checks for overlaps between two game objects. The objects can be Sprites, Groups or Emitters.
You can perform Sprite vs. Sprite, Sprite vs. Group and Group vs. Group overlap checks.
Unlike collide the objects are NOT automatically separated or have any physics applied, they merely test for overlap results.
Both the first and second parameter can be arrays of objects, of differing types.
If two arrays are passed, the contents of the first parameter will be tested against all contents of the 2nd parameter.
NOTE: This function is not recursive, and will not test against children of objects passed (i.e. Groups within Groups).

class.help:
The atlas file loader is used to load in Texture Atlas data and parse it. When loaded this class will dispatch a 'loaded' event. If loading fails this class will dispatch an 'error' event.

To generate the data you can use http://www.codeandweb.com/texturepacker and publish in the 'JSON' format.

It is highly recommended to use texture atlases (also know as 'sprite sheets') as it allowed sprites to be batched and drawn together for highly increased rendering speed.
Once the data has been loaded the frames are stored in the PIXI texture cache and can be accessed though PIXI.Texture.fromFrameId() and PIXI.Sprite.fromFrameId()

parameters.name: url
parameters.help: The url of the JSON file

parameters.name: crossorigin
parameters.help: Whether requests should be treated as crossorigin

class.name: PIXI.AtlasLoader

public.name: load
public.help: Starts loading the JSON file

private.name: onAtlasLoaded
private.help: Invoked when the Atlas has fully loaded. Parses the JSON and builds the texture frames.

private.name: onError
private.help: Invoked when an error occurs.

private.name: onLoaded
private.help: Invoked when json file has loaded.

public.name: alpha
public.help: The opacity of the object.

public.name: anchor
public.help:
The anchor sets the origin point of the texture.
The default is 0,0 this means the texture's origin is the top left
Setting than anchor to 0.5,0.5 means the textures origin is centered
Setting the anchor to 1,1 would mean the textures origin points will be the bottom right corner

public.name: animationSpeed
public.help: The speed that the MovieClip will play at. Higher is faster, lower is slower

public.name: blendMode
public.help: The blend mode to be applied to the sprite. Set to PIXI.blendModes.NORMAL to remove any blend mode.

public.name: buttonMode
public.help: This is used to indicate if the displayObject should display a mouse hand cursor on rollover

public.name: cacheAsBitmap
public.help: Set if this display object is cached as a bitmap.\nThis basically takes a snap shot of the display object as it is at that moment. It can provide a performance benefit for complex static displayObjects.\nTo remove simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: children
public.help: [read-only] The array of children of this container.

public.name: currentFrame
public.help: [read-only] The MovieClips current frame index (this may not have to be a whole number)

public.name: defaultCursor
public.help: This is the cursor that will be used when the mouse is over this object. To enable this the element must have interaction = true and buttonMode = true\n

public.name: filterArea
public.help: The area the filter is applied to like the hitArea this is used as more of an optimisation\nrather than figuring out the dimensions of the displayObject each frame you can set this rectangle

public.name: filters
public.help: Sets the filters for the displayObject.\n* IMPORTANT: This is a webGL only feature and will be ignored by the canvas renderer.\nTo remove filters simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: height
public.help: The height of the sprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

public.name: hitArea
public.help: This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default.\nSetting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)

public.name: interactive
public.help: Indicates if the sprite will have touch and mouse interactivity. It is false by default

public.name: loop
public.help: Whether or not the movie clip repeats after playing.

public.name: mask
public.help: Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it.\nIn PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping.\nTo remove a mask, set this property to null.

public.name: scale

public.name: shader

public.name: stage

public.name: tint
public.help: The tint applied to the sprite. This is a hex value. A value of 0xFFFFFF will remove any tint effect.

public.name: totalFrames
public.help: [read-only] totalFrames is the total number of frames in the MovieClip. This is the same as number of textures\nassigned to the MovieClip.

public.name: visible

public.name: width
