public.name: map
public.help: The texture used for the displacement map. Must be power of 2 sized texture.

class.help: The AlphaMaskFilter class uses the pixel values from the specified texture (called the displacement map) to perform a displacement of an object.\nYou can use this filter to apply all manor of crazy warping effects\nCurrently the r property of the texture is used to offset the x and the g property of the texture is used to offset the y.

parameters.name: texture
parameters.help: The texture used for the displacement map * must be power of 2 texture at the moment

class.name: PIXI.AlphaMaskFilter

public.name: onTextureLoaded
public.help: Sets the map dimensions uniforms when the texture becomes available.

public.name: syncUniforms
public.help: Syncs the uniforms between the class object and the shaders.

protected.name: type
protected.inlineHelp: Internal Phaser Type value.

public.name: alive
public.inlineHelp: The alive property is useful for Groups that are children of other Groups and need to be included/excluded in checks like forEachAlive.

public.name: alpha
public.help: The opacity of the object.

public.name: alphaData
public.inlineHelp: An array of the calculated alpha easing data applied to particles with alphaRates > 0.

public.name: angle
public.inlineHelp: The angle of rotation given in degrees, where 0 degrees = to the right.
public.help: The angle of rotation of the Group container. This will adjust the Group container itself by modifying its rotation.\nThis will have no impact on the rotation value of its children, but it will update their worldTransform and on-screen position.

public.name: angularDrag
public.inlineHelp: The angular drag component of particles launched from the emitter if they are rotating.

public.name: area
public.inlineHelp: The area of the emitter. Particles can be randomly generated from anywhere within this rectangle.

public.name: autoAlpha
public.inlineHelp: When a new Particle is emitted this controls if it will automatically change alpha. Use Emitter.setAlpha to configure.

public.name: autoScale
public.inlineHelp: When a new Particle is emitted this controls if it will automatically scale in size. Use Emitter.setScale to configure.

public.name: blendMode
public.inlineHelp: The blendMode as set on the particle when emitted from the Emitter. Defaults to NORMAL. Needs browser capable of supporting canvas blend-modes (most not available in WebGL)

public.name: bottom
public.inlineHelp: Gets the bottom position of the Emitter.

public.name: bounce
public.inlineHelp: How much each particle should bounce on each axis. 1 = full bounce, 0 = no bounce.

public.name: buttonMode
public.help: This is used to indicate if the displayObject should display a mouse hand cursor on rollover

public.name: cacheAsBitmap
public.help: Set if this display object is cached as a bitmap.\nThis basically takes a snap shot of the display object as it is at that moment. It can provide a performance benefit for complex static displayObjects.\nTo remove simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: cameraOffset
public.inlineHelp: If this object is fixedToCamera then this stores the x/y offset that its drawn at, from the top-left of the camera view.

public.name: children
public.help: [read-only] The array of children of this container.

public.name: classType
public.help: The type of objects that will be created when you use Group.create or Group.createMultiple. Defaults to Phaser.Sprite.\nWhen a new object is created it is passed the following parameters to its constructor: game, x, y, key, frame.

public.name: cursor
public.inlineHelp: The current display object that the Group cursor is pointing to.
public.help: The cursor is a simple way to iterate through the objects in a Group using the Group.next and Group.previous functions.\nThe cursor is set to the first child added to the Group and doesn't change unless you call next, previous or set it directly with Group.cursor.

public.name: defaultCursor
public.help: This is the cursor that will be used when the mouse is over this object. To enable this the element must have interaction = true and buttonMode = true\n

public.name: emitX
public.help: The point the particles are emitted from.\nEmitter.x and Emitter.y control the containers location, which updates all current particles\nEmitter.emitX and Emitter.emitY control the emission location relative to the x/y position.

public.name: emitY
public.help: The point the particles are emitted from.\nEmitter.x and Emitter.y control the containers location, which updates all current particles\nEmitter.emitX and Emitter.emitY control the emission location relative to the x/y position.

public.name: enableBody
public.inlineHelp: If true all Sprites created by, or added to this Group, will have a physics body enabled on them. Change the body type with `Group.physicsBodyType`.

public.name: enableBodyDebug
public.inlineHelp: If true when a physics body is created (via Group.enableBody) it will create a physics debug object as well. Only works for P2 bodies.

public.name: exists
public.inlineHelp: If exists is true the Group is updated, otherwise it is skipped.

public.name: filterArea
public.help: The area the filter is applied to like the hitArea this is used as more of an optimisation\nrather than figuring out the dimensions of the displayObject each frame you can set this rectangle

public.name: filters
public.help: Sets the filters for the displayObject.\n* IMPORTANT: This is a webGL only feature and will be ignored by the canvas renderer.\nTo remove filters simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: fixedToCamera
public.inlineHelp: Set to true to fix this Group to the Camera at its current world coordinates.
public.help: A Group that is fixed to the camera uses its x/y coordinates as offsets from the top left of the camera. These are stored in Group.cameraOffset.\nNote that the cameraOffset values are in addition to any parent in the display list.\nSo if this Group was in a Group that has x: 200, then this will be added to the cameraOffset.x

public.name: frequency
public.inlineHelp: How often a particle is emitted in ms (if emitter is started with Explode === false).

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the currently running Game.

public.name: gravity
public.inlineHelp: Sets the `body.gravity.y` of each particle sprite to this value on launch.

public.name: height
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the height of the Emitter. This is the region in which a particle can be emitted.

public.name: hitArea
public.help: This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default.\nSetting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)

public.name: ignoreDestroy
public.inlineHelp: A Group with `ignoreDestroy` set to `true` ignores all calls to its `destroy` method.

public.name: interactive
public.help: Indicates if the sprite will have touch and mouse interactivity. It is false by default

public.name: left
public.inlineHelp: Gets the left position of the Emitter.

public.name: length
public.inlineHelp: The total number of children in this Group, regardless of their exists/alive status.

public.name: lifespan
public.inlineHelp: How long each particle lives once it is emitted in ms. Default is 2 seconds. Set lifespan to 'zero' for particles to live forever.

public.name: mask
public.help: Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it.\nIn PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping.\nTo remove a mask, set this property to null.

public.name: maxParticleAlpha
public.inlineHelp: The maximum possible alpha value of a particle.

public.name: maxParticleScale
public.inlineHelp: The maximum possible scale of a particle. This is applied to the X and Y axis. If you need to control each axis see maxParticleScaleX.

public.name: maxParticleSpeed
public.inlineHelp: The maximum possible velocity of a particle.

public.name: maxParticles
public.inlineHelp: The total number of particles in this emitter.

public.name: maxRotation
public.inlineHelp: The maximum possible angular velocity of a particle.

public.name: minParticleAlpha
public.inlineHelp: The minimum possible alpha value of a particle.

public.name: minParticleScale
public.inlineHelp: The minimum possible scale of a particle. This is applied to the X and Y axis. If you need to control each axis see minParticleScaleX.

public.name: minParticleSpeed
public.inlineHelp: The minimum possible velocity of a particle.

public.name: minRotation
public.inlineHelp: The minimum possible angular velocity of a particle.

public.name: name
public.inlineHelp: A handy string name for this emitter. Can be set to anything.

public.name: on
public.inlineHelp: Determines whether the emitter is currently emitting particles. It is totally safe to directly toggle this.

public.name: onDestroy
public.inlineHelp: This signal is dispatched when the parent is destoyed.

public.name: parent
public.inlineHelp: The parent of this Group.

public.name: particleAnchor
public.inlineHelp: When a particle is created its anchor will be set to match this Point object (defaults to x/y: 0.5 to aid in rotation)

public.name: particleBringToTop
public.inlineHelp: If this is `true` then when the Particle is emitted it will be bought to the top of the Emitters display list.

public.name: particleClass
public.inlineHelp: For emitting your own particle class types. They must extend Phaser.Particle.

public.name: particleDrag
public.inlineHelp: The X and Y drag component of particles launched from the emitter.

public.name: particleSendToBack
public.inlineHelp: If this is `true` then when the Particle is emitted it will be sent to the back of the Emitters display list.

public.name: physicsBodyType
public.inlineHelp: If Group.enableBody is true this is the type of physics body that is created on new Sprites. Phaser.Physics.ARCADE, Phaser.Physics.P2, Phaser.Physics.NINJA, etc.

public.name: pivot
public.inlineHelp: The pivot point of the Group container.

public.name: position
public.help: The coordinate of the object relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

public.name: renderable
public.help: Can this object be rendered

public.name: right
public.inlineHelp: Gets the right position of the Emitter.

public.name: rotation
public.inlineHelp: The angle of rotation given in radians.
public.help: The angle of rotation of the Group container. This will adjust the Group container itself by modifying its rotation.\nThis will have no impact on the rotation value of its children, but it will update their worldTransform and on-screen position.

public.name: scale
public.inlineHelp: The scale of the Group container.

public.name: scaleData
public.inlineHelp: An array of the calculated scale easing data applied to particles with scaleRates > 0.

public.name: stage
public.help: [read-only] The stage the display object is connected to, or undefined if it is not connected to the stage.

public.name: top
public.inlineHelp: Gets the top position of the Emitter.

public.name: total
public.inlineHelp: The total number of children in this Group who have a state of exists = true.

public.name: visible
public.inlineHelp: The visible state of the Group. Non-visible Groups and all of their children are not rendered.

public.name: width
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the width of the Emitter. This is the region in which a particle can be emitted.

public.name: worldAlpha
public.help: [read-only] The multiplied alpha of the displayObject

public.name: worldVisible
public.help: [read-only] Indicates if the sprite is globally visible.

public.name: x
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the x position of the Emitter.

public.name: y
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the y position of the Emitter.

public.name: z
public.inlineHelp: The z-depth value of this object within its Group (remember the World is a Group as well). No two objects in a Group can have the same z value.

private.name: _counter
private.inlineHelp: Internal counter for figuring out how many particles to launch.

private.name: _explode
private.inlineHelp: Internal helper for the style of particle emission (all at once, or one at a time).

private.name: _frames
private.inlineHelp: Internal helper for the particle frame.

private.name: _quantity
private.inlineHelp: Internal helper for deciding how many particles to launch.

private.name: _timer
private.inlineHelp: Internal helper for deciding when to launch particles or kill them.

class.help: Emitter is a lightweight particle emitter that uses Arcade Physics.\nIt can be used for one-time explosions or for continuous effects like rain and fire.\nAll it really does is launch Particle objects out at set intervals, and fixes their positions and velocities accordingly.

parameters.name: game
parameters.help: Current game instance.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: The x coordinate within the Emitter that the particles are emitted from.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The y coordinate within the Emitter that the particles are emitted from.

parameters.name: maxParticles
parameters.help: The total number of particles in this emitter.

class.name: Phaser.Particles.Arcade.Emitter

public.name: add

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: An instance of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the child will not dispatch the onAddedToGroup event.

returns.help: The child that was added to the Group.

public.help: Adds an existing object to this Group. The object can be an instance of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object.\nThe child is automatically added to the top of the Group, so renders on-top of everything else within the Group. If you need to control\nthat then see the addAt method.

public.name: addAll

parameters.name: property
parameters.help: The property to increment, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.help: The amount to increment the property by. If child.x = 10 then addAll('x', 40) would make child.x = 50.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

public.help: Adds the amount to the given property on all children in this Group.\nGroup.addAll('x', 10) will add 10 to the child.x value.

public.name: addAt

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: An instance of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object..

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index within the Group to insert the child to.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the child will not dispatch the onAddedToGroup event.

returns.help: The child that was added to the Group.

public.help: Adds an existing object to this Group. The object can be an instance of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object.\nThe child is added to the Group at the location specified by the index value, this allows you to control child ordering.

public.name: addChild

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The DisplayObject to add to the container

returns.help: The child that was added.

public.help: Adds a child to the container.

public.name: addChildAt

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to add

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index to place the child in

returns.help: The child that was added.

public.help: Adds a child to the container at a specified index. If the index is out of bounds an error will be thrown

public.name: addMultiple

parameters.name: children
parameters.help: An array containing instances of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the children will not dispatch the onAddedToGroup event.

returns.help: The array of children that were added to the Group.

public.help: Adds an array existing objects to this Group. The objects can be instances of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object.\nThe children are automatically added to the top of the Group, so render on-top of everything else within the Group.\nTODO: Add ability to pass the children as parameters rather than having to be an array.

public.name: ascendingSortHandler

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The first object being sorted.

parameters.name: b
parameters.help: The second object being sorted.

public.help: An internal helper function for the sort process.

public.name: at

parameters.name: object
parameters.help: The object that you wish to match the center with.

public.help: Change the emitters center to match the center of any object with a `center` property, such as a Sprite.\nIf the object doesn't have a center property it will be set to object.x + object.width / 2

public.name: bringToTop

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to bring to the top of this Group.

returns.help: The child that was moved.

public.help: Brings the given child to the top of this Group so it renders above all other children.

public.name: callAll

parameters.name: method
parameters.help: A string containing the name of the function that will be called. The function must exist on the child.

parameters.name: context
parameters.help: A string containing the context under which the method will be executed. Set to null to default to the child.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.help: Additional parameters that will be passed to the method.

public.help: Calls a function on all of the children regardless if they are dead or alive (see callAllExists if you need control over that)\nAfter the method parameter and context you can add as many extra parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child.

public.name: callAllExists

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that exists on the children that will be called.

parameters.name: existsValue
parameters.help: Only children with exists=existsValue will be called.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.help: Additional parameters that will be passed to the callback.

public.help: Calls a function on all of the children that have exists=true in this Group.\nAfter the existsValue parameter you can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child callback.

public.name: checkAll

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be checked.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If set then only children with alive=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If set then only children with visible=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.

public.help: This function allows you to quickly check that the same property across all children of this Group is equal to the given value.\nThis call doesn't descend down children, so if you have a Group inside of this Group, the property will be checked on the Group but not its children.

public.name: checkProperty

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to check the property value on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: An array of strings that make up the property that will be set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be checked.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.

returns.help: True if the property was was equal to value, false if not.

public.help: Checks a property for the given value on the child.

public.name: click
public.help: A callback that is used when the users clicks on the displayObject with their mouse's left button

public.name: countDead

returns.help: The number of children flagged as dead.

public.help: Call this function to find out how many members of the group are dead.

public.name: countLiving

returns.help: The number of children flagged as alive.

public.help: Call this function to find out how many members of the group are alive.

public.name: create

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: The x coordinate to display the newly created Sprite at. The value is in relation to the Group.x point.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The y coordinate to display the newly created Sprite at. The value is in relation to the Group.y point.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.help: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.

parameters.name: exists
parameters.help: The default exists state of the Sprite.

returns.help: The child that was created. Will be a Phaser.Sprite unless Group.classType has been changed.

public.help: Automatically creates a new Phaser.Sprite object and adds it to the top of this Group.\nYou can change Group.classType to any object and this call will create an object of that type instead, but it should extend either Sprite or Image.

public.name: createMultiple

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.help: The number of Sprites to create.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.help: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.

parameters.name: exists
parameters.help: The default exists state of the Sprite.

public.help:
Automatically creates multiple Phaser.Sprite objects and adds them to the top of this Group.
Useful if you need to quickly generate a pool of identical sprites, such as bullets. By default the sprites will be set to not exist
and will be positioned at 0, 0 (relative to the Group.x/y)
You can change Group.classType to any object and this call will create an object of that type instead, but it should extend either Sprite or Image.

public.name: customSort

parameters.name: sortHandler
parameters.help: Your sort handler function. It will be sent two parameters: the two children involved in the comparison. It must return -1, 1 or 0.

parameters.name: context
parameters.help: The scope in which the sortHandler is called.

public.help: This allows you to use your own sort handler function.\nIt will be sent two parameters: the two children involved in the comparison (a and b). It should return -1 if a > b, 1 if a < b or 0 if a === b.

public.name: descendingSortHandler

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The first object being sorted.

parameters.name: b
parameters.help: The second object being sorted.

public.help: An internal helper function for the sort process.

public.name: destroy

parameters.name: destroyChildren
parameters.help: Should every child of this Group have its destroy method called?

parameters.name: soft
parameters.help: A 'soft destroy' (set to true) doesn't remove this Group from its parent or null the game reference. Set to false and it does.

public.help: Destroys this Group. Removes all children, then removes the container from the display list and nulls references.

public.name: divideAll

parameters.name: property
parameters.help: The property to divide, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.help: The amount to divide the property by. If child.x = 100 then divideAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 50.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

public.help: Divides the given property by the amount on all children in this Group.\nGroup.divideAll('x', 2) will half the child.x value.

public.name: emitParticle
public.help: This function can be used both internally and externally to emit the next particle in the queue.

public.name: explode

parameters.name: lifespan
parameters.help: How long each particle lives once emitted in ms. 0 = forever.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.help: How many particles to launch.

public.help: Call this function to emit the given quantity of particles at all once (an explosion)

public.name: filter

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.help: The function that each child will be evaluated against. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter, the index as the second, and the entire child array as the third

parameters.name: checkExists
parameters.help: If set only children with exists=true will be passed to the callback, otherwise all children will be passed.

returns.help: Returns an array list containing all the children that the predicate returned true for

public.name: flow

parameters.name: lifespan
parameters.help: How long each particle lives once emitted in ms. 0 = forever.

parameters.name: frequency
parameters.help: Frequency is how often to emit a particle, given in ms.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.help: How many particles to launch.

public.help: Call this function to start emitting a flow of particles at the given frequency.

public.name: forEach

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that will be called. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

parameters.name: checkExists
parameters.help: If set only children with exists=true will be passed to the callback, otherwise all children will be passed.

public.help:
Allows you to call your own function on each member of this Group. You must pass the callback and context in which it will run.
After the checkExists parameter you can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child.
For example: Group.forEach(awardBonusGold, this, true, 100, 500)
Note: Currently this will skip any children which are Groups themselves.

public.name: forEachAlive

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that will be called. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

public.help: Allows you to call your own function on each alive member of this Group (where child.alive=true). You must pass the callback and context in which it will run.\nYou can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child.\nFor example: Group.forEachAlive(causeDamage, this, 500)

public.name: forEachDead

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that will be called. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

public.help: Allows you to call your own function on each dead member of this Group (where alive=false). You must pass the callback and context in which it will run.\nYou can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child.\nFor example: Group.forEachDead(bringToLife, this)

public.name: forEachExists

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that will be called. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

public.help: Allows you to call your own function on each member of this Group where child.exists=true. You must pass the callback and context in which it will run.\nYou can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child.\nFor example: Group.forEachExists(causeDamage, this, 500)

public.name: generateTexture

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.help: The resolution of the texture being generated

parameters.name: scaleMode
parameters.help: Should be one of the PIXI.scaleMode consts

parameters.name: renderer
parameters.help: The renderer used to generate the texture.

returns.help: a texture of the graphics object

public.help: Useful function that returns a texture of the displayObject object that can then be used to create sprites\nThis can be quite useful if your displayObject is static / complicated and needs to be reused multiple times.

public.name: getAt

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index to return the child from.

returns.help: The child that was found at the given index. If the index was out of bounds then this will return -1.

public.help: Returns the child found at the given index within this Group.

public.name: getBottom

returns.help: The child at the bottom of the Group.

public.help: Returns the child at the bottom of this Group. The bottom is the one being displayed (rendered) below every other child.

public.name: getBounds

returns.help: The rectangular bounding area

public.help: Retrieves the bounds of the displayObjectContainer as a rectangle. The bounds calculation takes all visible children into consideration.

public.name: getChildAt

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index to get the child from

returns.help: The child at the given index, if any.

public.help: Returns the child at the specified index

parameters.name: child

public.help: Returns the index position of a child DisplayObject instance

public.name: getFirstAlive

returns.help: The first alive child, or null if none found.

public.help: Call this function to retrieve the first object with alive === true in the group.\nThis is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

public.name: getFirstDead

returns.help: The first dead child, or null if none found.

public.help: Call this function to retrieve the first object with alive === false in the group.\nThis is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

public.name: getFirstExists

parameters.name: state
parameters.help: True or false.

returns.help: The first child, or null if none found.

public.help: Call this function to retrieve the first object with exists == (the given state) in the Group.

public.name: getIndex

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to get the index for.

returns.help: The index of the child or -1 if it's not a member of this Group.

public.help: Get the index position of the given child in this Group. This should always match the childs z property.

public.name: getLocalBounds

returns.help: The rectangular bounding area

public.help: Retrieves the non-global local bounds of the displayObjectContainer as a rectangle. The calculation takes all visible children into consideration.

public.name: getRandom

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.help: Optional offset off the front of the array. Default value is 0, or the beginning of the array.

parameters.name: length
parameters.help: Optional restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.

returns.help: A random child of this Group.

public.help: Returns a member at random from the group.

public.name: getTop

returns.help: The child at the top of the Group.

public.help: Returns the child at the top of this Group. The top is the one being displayed (rendered) above every other child.

public.name: hasProperty

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to check for the existance of the property on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: An array of strings that make up the property.

returns.help: True if the child has the property, otherwise false.

public.help: Checks if the child has the given property. Will scan up to 4 levels deep only.

public.name: iterate

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The child property to check, i.e. 'exists', 'alive', 'health'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: If child.key === this value it will be considered a match. Note that a strict comparison is used.

parameters.name: returnType
parameters.help: How to return the data from this method. Either Phaser.Group.RETURN_NONE, Phaser.Group.RETURN_TOTAL or Phaser.Group.RETURN_CHILD.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: Optional function that will be called on each matching child. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

returns.help: Returns either a numeric total (if RETURN_TOTAL was specified) or the child object.

public.help: Iterates over the children of the Group. When a child has a property matching key that equals the given value, it is considered as a match.\nMatched children can be sent to the optional callback, or simply returned or counted.\nYou can add as many callback parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child, after the callbackContext parameter.

public.name: kill
public.help: Call this function to turn off all the particles and the emitter.

public.name: makeParticles

parameters.name: keys
parameters.help: A string or an array of strings that the particle sprites will use as their texture. If an array one is picked at random.

parameters.name: frames
parameters.help: A frame number, or array of frames that the sprite will use. If an array one is picked at random.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.help: The number of particles to generate. If not given it will use the value of Emitter.maxParticles.

parameters.name: collide
parameters.help: If you want the particles to be able to collide with other Arcade Physics bodies then set this to true.

parameters.name: collideWorldBounds
parameters.help: A particle can be set to collide against the World bounds automatically and rebound back into the World if this is set to true. Otherwise it will leave the World.

returns.help: This Emitter instance.

public.help: This function generates a new set of particles for use by this emitter.\nThe particles are stored internally waiting to be emitted via Emitter.start.

public.name: mousedown
public.help: A callback that is used when the user clicks the mouse's left button down over the sprite

public.name: mouseout
public.help: A callback that is used when the users mouse leaves the displayObject

public.name: mouseover
public.help: A callback that is used when the users mouse rolls over the displayObject

public.name: mouseup
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's left button that was over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired, the mouse's left button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

public.name: mouseupoutside
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's left button that was over the displayObject but is no longer over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired, the mouse's left button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

public.name: moveDown

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to move down in the Group.

returns.help: The child that was moved.

public.name: moveUp

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to move up in the Group.

returns.help: The child that was moved.

public.help: Moves the given child up one place in this Group unless it's already at the top.

public.name: multiplyAll

parameters.name: property
parameters.help: The property to multiply, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.help: The amount to multiply the property by. If child.x = 10 then multiplyAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 20.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

public.help: Multiplies the given property by the amount on all children in this Group.\nGroup.multiplyAll('x', 2) will x2 the child.x value.

public.name: next

returns.help: The child the cursor now points to.

public.help: Advances the Group cursor to the next object in the Group. If it's at the end of the Group it wraps around to the first object.

public.name: previous

returns.help: The child the cursor now points to.

public.help: Moves the Group cursor to the previous object in the Group. If it's at the start of the Group it wraps around to the last object.

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to remove.

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.help: You can optionally call destroy on the child that was removed.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the child will not dispatch the onRemovedFromGroup event.

returns.help: true if the child was removed from this Group, otherwise false.

public.help: Removes the given child from this Group. This will dispatch an onRemovedFromGroup event from the child (if it has one),\nreset the Group cursor and optionally destroy the child.

public.name: removeAll

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.help: You can optionally call destroy on each child that is removed.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the children will not dispatch their onRemovedFromGroup events.

public.help: Removes all children from this Group, setting the group properties of the children to `null`.\nThe Group container remains on the display list.

public.name: removeBetween

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.help: The index to start removing children from.

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.help: The index to stop removing children at. Must be higher than startIndex. If undefined this method will remove all children between startIndex and the end of the Group.

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.help: You can optionally call destroy on the child that was removed.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the children will not dispatch their onRemovedFromGroup events.

public.help: Removes all children from this Group whos index falls beteen the given startIndex and endIndex values.

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The DisplayObject to remove

returns.help: The child that was removed.

public.help: Removes a child from the container.

public.name: removeChildAt

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index to get the child from

returns.help: The child that was removed.

public.name: removeChildren

parameters.name: beginIndex
parameters.help: The beginning position. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.help: The ending position. Default value is size of the container.

public.help: Removes all children from this container that are within the begin and end indexes.

public.name: removeStageReference
public.help: Removes the current stage reference from the container and all of its children.

parameters.name: oldChild
parameters.help: The child in this Group that will be replaced.

parameters.name: newChild
parameters.help: The child to be inserted into this Group.

returns.help: Returns the oldChild that was replaced within this Group.

public.help: Replaces a child of this Group with the given newChild. The newChild cannot be a member of this Group.

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: Set the cursor to point to a specific index.

returns.help: The child the cursor now points to.

public.help: Sets the Group cursor to the first object in the Group. If the optional index parameter is given it sets the cursor to the object at that index instead.

public.name: reverse
public.help: Reverses all children in this Group. Note that this does not propagate, only direct children are re-ordered.

public.name: revive
public.help: Handy for bringing game objects "back to life". Just sets alive and exists back to true.

public.help: A callback that is used when the users clicks on the displayObject with their mouse's right button

public.name: rightdown

public.name: rightup
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's right button that was over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired the mouse's right button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

public.name: rightupoutside
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's right button that was over the displayObject but is no longer over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired, the mouse's right button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to send to the bottom of this Group.

returns.help: The child that was moved.

public.name: set

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to set the property on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If set then the child will only be updated if alive=true.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If set then the child will only be updated if visible=true.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.help: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

returns.help: True if the property was set, false if not.

public.help: This function allows you to quickly set a property on a single child of this Group to a new value.\nThe operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

public.name: setAll

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If set then only children with alive=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If set then only children with visible=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.help: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

public.help:
This function allows you to quickly set the same property across all children of this Group to a new value.
This call doesn't descend down children, so if you have a Group inside of this Group, the property will be set on the Group but not its children.
If you need that ability please see `Group.setAllChildren`.

The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

public.name: setAllChildren

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If set then only children with alive=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If set then only children with visible=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.help: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

public.help:
This function allows you to quickly set the same property across all children of this Group, and any child Groups, to a new value.

If this Group contains other Groups then the same property is set across their children as well, iterating down until it reaches the bottom.
Unlike with Group.setAll the property is NOT set on child Groups itself.

The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

public.name: setAlpha

parameters.name: min
parameters.help: The minimum value for this range.

parameters.name: max
parameters.help: The maximum value for this range.

parameters.name: rate
parameters.help: The rate (in ms) at which the particles will change in alpha from min to max, or set to zero to pick a random alpha between the two.

parameters.name: ease
parameters.help: If you've set a rate > 0 this is the easing formula applied between the min and max values.

parameters.name: yoyo
parameters.help: If you've set a rate > 0 you can set if the ease will yoyo or not (i.e. ease back to its original values)

public.help: A more compact way of setting the alpha constraints of the particles.\nThe rate parameter, if set to a value above zero, lets you set the speed at which the Particle change in alpha from min to max.\nIf rate is zero, which is the default, the particle won't change alpha - instead it will pick a random alpha between min and max on emit.

public.name: setChildIndex

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child DisplayObject instance for which you want to change the index number

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The resulting index number for the child display object

public.help: Changes the position of an existing child in the display object container

public.name: setProperty

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to set the property value on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: An array of strings that make up the property that will be set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.help: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

returns.help: True if the property was set, false if not.

public.help:
Sets a property to the given value on the child. The operation parameter controls how the value is set.
Operation 0 means set the existing value to the given value, or if force is `false` create a new property with the given value.
1 will add the given value to the value already present.
2 will subtract the given value from the value already present.
3 will multiply the value already present by the given value.
4 will divide the value already present by the given value.

public.name: setRotation

parameters.name: min
parameters.help: The minimum value for this range.

parameters.name: max
parameters.help: The maximum value for this range.

public.help: A more compact way of setting the angular velocity constraints of the particles.

public.name: setScale

parameters.name: minX
parameters.help: The minimum value of Particle.scale.x.

parameters.name: maxX
parameters.help: The maximum value of Particle.scale.x.

parameters.name: minY
parameters.help: The minimum value of Particle.scale.y.

parameters.name: maxY
parameters.help: The maximum value of Particle.scale.y.

parameters.name: rate
parameters.help: The rate (in ms) at which the particles will change in scale from min to max, or set to zero to pick a random size between the two.

parameters.name: ease
parameters.help: If you've set a rate > 0 this is the easing formula applied between the min and max values.

parameters.name: yoyo
parameters.help: If you've set a rate > 0 you can set if the ease will yoyo or not (i.e. ease back to its original values)

public.help: A more compact way of setting the scale constraints of the particles.\nThe rate parameter, if set to a value above zero, lets you set the speed and ease which the Particle uses to change in scale from min to max across both axis.\nIf rate is zero, which is the default, the particle won't change scale during update, instead it will pick a random scale between min and max on emit.

public.name: setSize

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The desired width of the emitter (particles are spawned randomly within these dimensions).

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The desired height of the emitter.

public.help: A more compact way of setting the width and height of the emitter.

public.name: setStageReference

parameters.name: stage
parameters.help: the stage that the container will have as its current stage reference

public.help: Sets the containers Stage reference. This is the Stage that this object, and all of its children, is connected to.

public.name: setXSpeed

parameters.name: min
parameters.help: The minimum value for this range.

parameters.name: max
parameters.help: The maximum value for this range.

public.help: A more compact way of setting the X velocity range of the emitter.

public.name: setYSpeed

parameters.name: min
parameters.help: The minimum value for this range.

parameters.name: max
parameters.help: The maximum value for this range.

public.help: A more compact way of setting the Y velocity range of the emitter.

public.name: sort

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The `string` name of the property you want to sort on. Defaults to the objects z-depth value.

parameters.name: order
parameters.help: The `Group` constant that defines the sort order. Possible values are Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING and Phaser.Group.SORT_DESCENDING.

public.help: Call this function to sort the group according to a particular value and order.\nFor example to depth sort Sprites for Zelda-style game you might call `group.sort('y', Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING)` at the bottom of your `State.update()`.

public.name: start

parameters.name: explode
parameters.help: Whether the particles should all burst out at once (true) or at the frequency given (false).

parameters.name: lifespan
parameters.help: How long each particle lives once emitted in ms. 0 = forever.

parameters.name: frequency
parameters.help: Ignored if Explode is set to true. Frequency is how often to emit 1 particle. Value given in ms.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.help: How many particles to launch. 0 = "all of the particles".

parameters.name: forceQuantity
parameters.help: If true and creating a particle flow, the quantity emitted will be forced to the be quantity given in this call.

public.help: Call this function to start emitting particles.

public.name: subAll

parameters.name: property
parameters.help: The property to decrement, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.help: The amount to subtract from the property. If child.x = 50 then subAll('x', 40) would make child.x = 10.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

public.help: Subtracts the amount from the given property on all children in this Group.\nGroup.subAll('x', 10) will minus 10 from the child.x value.

public.name: swap

parameters.help: The second child to swap.

public.help: Swaps the position of 2 Display Objects within this container.

parameters.name: x

class.help:
WARNING: This is an EXPERIMENTAL class. The API will change significantly in the coming versions and is incomplete.
Please try to avoid using in production games with a long time to build.
This is also why the documentation is incomplete.

FlexGrid is a a responsive grid manager that works in conjunction with the ScaleManager RESIZE scaling mode and FlexLayers
to provide for game object positioning in a responsive manner.

parameters.name: manager
parameters.help: The ScaleManager.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width of the game.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height of the game.

parameters.name: children

public.name: createFluidLayer

parameters.name: children
parameters.help: An array of children that are used to populate the FlexLayer.

returns.help: The Layer object.

public.help: A fluid layer is centered on the game and maintains its aspect ratio as it scales up and down.

public.name: createFullLayer

parameters.name: children
parameters.help: An array of children that are used to populate the FlexLayer.

returns.help: The Layer object.

public.help: A full layer is placed at 0,0 and extends to the full size of the game. Children are scaled according to the fluid ratios.

public.name: alpha
public.help: The opacity of the object.

public.name: anchor
public.help:
The anchor sets the origin point of the texture.
The default is 0,0 this means the texture's origin is the top left
Setting than anchor to 0.5,0.5 means the textures origin is centered
Setting the anchor to 1,1 would mean the textures origin points will be the bottom right corner

public.name: blendMode
public.help: The blend mode to be applied to the sprite. Set to PIXI.blendModes.NORMAL to remove any blend mode.

public.name: buttonMode
public.help: This is used to indicate if the displayObject should display a mouse hand cursor on rollover

public.name: cacheAsBitmap
public.help: Set if this display object is cached as a bitmap.\nThis basically takes a snap shot of the display object as it is at that moment. It can provide a performance benefit for complex static displayObjects.\nTo remove simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: children
public.help: [read-only] The array of children of this container.

public.name: defaultCursor
public.help: This is the cursor that will be used when the mouse is over this object. To enable this the element must have interaction = true and buttonMode = true\n

public.name: filterArea
public.help: The area the filter is applied to like the hitArea this is used as more of an optimisation\nrather than figuring out the dimensions of the displayObject each frame you can set this rectangle

public.name: filters
public.help: Sets the filters for the displayObject.\n* IMPORTANT: This is a webGL only feature and will be ignored by the canvas renderer.\nTo remove filters simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: height
public.help: The height of the sprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

public.name: hitArea
public.help: This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default.\nSetting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)

public.name: interactive
public.help: Indicates if the sprite will have touch and mouse interactivity. It is false by default

public.name: mask
public.help: Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it.\nIn PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping.\nTo remove a mask, set this property to null.

public.name: parent
public.help: [read-only] The display object container that contains this display object.

public.name: pivot
public.help: The pivot point of the displayObject that it rotates around

public.name: position
public.help: The coordinate of the object relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

public.name: renderable
public.help: Can this object be rendered

public.name: rotation
public.help: The rotation of the object in radians.

public.name: scale
public.help: The scale factor of the object.

public.name: shader
public.help: The shader that will be used to render the texture to the stage. Set to null to remove a current shader.

public.name: stage
public.help: [read-only] The stage the display object is connected to, or undefined if it is not connected to the stage.

public.name: texture
public.help: The texture that the sprite is using

public.name: tint
public.help: The tint applied to the sprite. This is a hex value. A value of 0xFFFFFF will remove any tint effect.

public.name: visible
public.help: The visibility of the object.

public.name: width
public.help: The width of the sprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

public.name: worldAlpha
public.help: [read-only] The multiplied alpha of the displayObject

public.name: worldVisible
public.help: [read-only] Indicates if the sprite is globally visible.

public.name: x
public.help: The position of the displayObject on the x axis relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

public.name: y
public.help: The position of the displayObject on the y axis relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

private.name: _height
private.help: The height of the sprite (this is initially set by the texture)

private.name: _width
private.help: The width of the sprite (this is initially set by the texture)

private.name: _tweens

class.help:
Phaser.Game has a single instance of the TweenManager through which all Tween objects are created and updated.
Tweens are hooked into the game clock and pause system, adjusting based on the game state.

TweenManager is based heavily on tween.js by http://soledadpenades.com.
The difference being that tweens belong to a games instance of TweenManager, rather than to a global TWEEN object.
It also has callbacks swapped for Signals and a few issues patched with regard to properties and completion errors.
Please see https://github.com/sole/tween.js for a full list of contributors.

parameters.name: game
parameters.help: A reference to the currently running game.

class.help:
The Gamepad class handles looking after gamepad input for your game.
Remember to call gamepad.start(); expecting input!

HTML5 GAMEPAD API SUPPORT IS AT AN EXPERIMENTAL STAGE!
At moment of writing this (end of 2013) only Chrome supports parts of it out of the box. Firefox supports it
via prefs flags (about:config, search gamepad). The browsers map the same controllers differently.
This class has constants for Windows 7 Chrome mapping of XBOX 360 controller.

public.name: chain

returns.help: Itself.

public.help: You can chain tweens together by passing a reference to the chain function. This enables one tween to call another on completion.\nYou can pass as many tweens as you like to this function, they will each be chained in sequence.

public.help: Set easing function this tween will use, i.e. Phaser.Easing.Linear.None.

public.name: from

parameters.name: properties
parameters.help: Properties you want to tween from.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.help: Duration of this tween in ms.

parameters.name: ease
parameters.help: Easing function. If not set it will default to Phaser.Easing.Linear.None.

parameters.name: autoStart
parameters.help: Whether this tween will start automatically or not.

parameters.name: delay
parameters.help: Delay before this tween will start, defaults to 0 (no delay). Value given is in ms.

parameters.name: repeat
parameters.help: Should the tween automatically restart once complete? If you want it to run forever set as Number.MAX_VALUE. This ignores any chained tweens.

parameters.name: yoyo
parameters.help: A tween that yoyos will reverse itself and play backwards automatically. A yoyo'd tween doesn't fire the Tween.onComplete event, so listen for Tween.onLoop instead.

returns.help: This Tween object.

public.help: Sets this tween to be a `from` tween on the properties given. A `from` tween starts at the given value and tweens to the current values.\nFor example a Sprite with an `x` coordinate of 100 could be tweened from `x: 200` by giving a properties object of `{ x: 200 }`.

public.name: generateData

parameters.name: frameRate
parameters.help: The speed in frames per second that the data should be generated at. The higher the value, the larger the array it creates.

parameters.name: data
parameters.help: If given the generated data will be appended to this array, otherwise a new array will be returned.

returns.help: An array of tweened values.

public.help: This will generate an array populated with the tweened object values from start to end.\nIt works by running the tween simulation at the given frame rate based on the values set-up in Tween.to and similar functions.\nIt ignores delay and repeat counts and any chained tweens. Just one play through of tween data is returned, including yoyo if set.

public.name: interpolation

parameters.name: interpolation
parameters.help: The interpolation function to use (Phaser.Math.linearInterpolation by default)

returns.help: Itself.

public.help: Set interpolation function the tween will use, by default it uses Phaser.Math.linearInterpolation.\nAlso available: Phaser.Math.bezierInterpolation and Phaser.Math.catmullRomInterpolation.

public.name: loop

returns.help: Itself.

public.help:
Loop a chain of tweens

Usage:
game.add.tween(p).to({ x: 700 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None, true)
.to({ y: 300 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None)
.to({ x: 0 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None)
.to({ y: 0 }, 1000, Phaser.Easing.Linear.None)
.loop();

class.help: Phaser.Input is the Input Manager for all types of Input across Phaser, including mouse, keyboard, touch and MSPointer.\nThe Input manager is updated automatically by the core game loop.

parameters.name: game
parameters.help: Current game instance.

class.name: Phaser.Input

protected.name: boot
protected.help: Starts the Input Manager running.

protected.name: update
protected.help: Updates the Input Manager. Called by the core Game loop.

public.name: addMoveCallback

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The callback that will be called each time the activePointer receives a DOM move event.

parameters.name: context
parameters.help: The context in which the callback will be called.

returns.help: The index of the callback entry. Use this index when calling Input.deleteMoveCallback.

public.help:
Adds a callback that is fired every time the activePointer receives a DOM move event such as a mousemove or touchmove.
It will be called every time the activePointer moves, which in a multi-touch game can be a lot of times, so this is best
to only use if you've limited input to a single pointer (i.e. mouse or touch).
The callback is added to the Phaser.Input.moveCallbacks array and should be removed with Phaser.Input.deleteMoveCallback.

public.name: addPointer

returns.help: A reference to the new Pointer object that was created.

public.name: getPointerFromId

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.help: The Pointer.pointerId value to search for.

returns.help: A Pointer object or null if no Pointer object matches the requested identifier.

public.help: Get the Pointer object whos `pointerId` property matches the given value.\nThe pointerId property is not set until the Pointer has been used at least once, as its populated by the DOM event.\nAlso it can change every time you press the pointer down if the browser recycles it.

public.name: getPointerFromIdentifier

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.help: The Pointer.identifier value to search for.

returns.help: A Pointer object or null if no Pointer object matches the requested identifier.

public.help:
Get the Pointer object whos `identifier` property matches the given identifier value.
The identifier property is not set until the Pointer has been used at least once, as its populated by the DOM event.
Also it can change every time you press the pointer down, and is not fixed once set.
Note: Not all browsers set the identifier property and it's not part of the W3C spec, so you may need getPointerFromId instead.

public.name: reset

parameters.name: hard
parameters.help: A soft reset won't reset any events or callbacks that are bound. A hard reset will.

public.help: Reset all of the Pointers and Input states. The optional `hard` parameter will reset any events or callbacks that may be bound.\nInput.reset is called automatically during a State change or if a game loses focus / visibility. If you wish to control the reset\ndirectly yourself then set InputManager.resetLocked to `true`.

parameters.name: y

parameters.name: event

returns.help: The Pointer object that was started or null if no Pointer object is available.

parameters.name: event

returns.help: The Pointer object that was stopped or null if no Pointer object is available.

public.name: alpha
public.help: The opacity of the object.

public.name: angle
public.inlineHelp: The angle of this Sprite in degrees.
public.help: Indicates the rotation of the Sprite, in degrees, from its original orientation. Values from 0 to 180 represent clockwise rotation; values from 0 to -180 represent counterclockwise rotation.\nValues outside this range are added to or subtracted from 360 to obtain a value within the range. For example, the statement player.angle = 450 is the same as player.angle = 90.\nIf you wish to work in radians instead of degrees use the property Sprite.rotation instead. Working in radians is also a little faster as it doesn't have to convert the angle.

public.name: animations
public.inlineHelp: This manages animations of the sprite. You can modify animations through it (see Phaser.AnimationManager)

public.name: autoCull
public.inlineHelp: A flag indicating if the Sprite should be automatically camera culled or not.
public.help: Should this Sprite be automatically culled if out of range of the camera?\nA culled sprite has its renderable property set to 'false'.\nBe advised this is quite an expensive operation, as it has to calculate the bounds of the object every frame, so only enable it if you really need it.

public.name: body
public.help:
By default Sprites won't add themselves to any physics system and their physics body will be `null`.
To enable them for physics you need to call `game.physics.enable(sprite, system)` where `sprite` is this object
and `system` is the Physics system you want to use to manage this body. Once enabled you can access all physics related properties via `Sprite.body`.

Important: Enabling a Sprite for P2 or Ninja physics will automatically set `Sprite.anchor` to 0.5 so the physics body is centered on the Sprite.
If you need a different result then adjust or re-create the Body shape offsets manually, and/or reset the anchor after enabling physics.

public.name: buttonMode
public.help: This is used to indicate if the displayObject should display a mouse hand cursor on rollover

public.name: cacheAsBitmap
public.help: Set if this display object is cached as a bitmap.\nThis basically takes a snap shot of the display object as it is at that moment. It can provide a performance benefit for complex static displayObjects.\nTo remove simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: cameraOffset
public.inlineHelp: If this object is fixedToCamera then this stores the x/y offset that its drawn at, from the top-left of the camera view.

public.name: checkWorldBounds
public.help: If true the Sprite checks if it is still within the world each frame, when it leaves the world it dispatches Sprite.events.onOutOfBounds\nand optionally kills the sprite (if Sprite.outOfBoundsKill is true). By default this is disabled because the Sprite has to calculate its\nbounds every frame to support it, and not all games need it. Enable it by setting the value to true.

public.name: children
public.help: [read-only] The array of children of this container.

public.name: defaultCursor
public.help: This is the cursor that will be used when the mouse is over this object. To enable this the element must have interaction = true and buttonMode = true\n

public.name: destroyPhase
public.inlineHelp: True if this object is currently being destroyed.

public.name: dirty
public.help: Whether the strip is dirty or not

public.name: events
public.inlineHelp: The Events you can subscribe to that are dispatched when certain things happen on this Sprite or its components.

public.name: exists
public.inlineHelp: If the Rope is processed by the core game update and physics.
public.help: Rope.exists controls if the core game loop and physics update this Rope or not.\nWhen you set Rope.exists to false it will remove its Body from the physics world (if it has one) and also set Rope.visible to false.\nSetting Rope.exists to true will re-add the Body to the physics world (if it has a body) and set Rope.visible to true.

public.name: filterArea
public.help: The area the filter is applied to like the hitArea this is used as more of an optimisation\nrather than figuring out the dimensions of the displayObject each frame you can set this rectangle

public.name: filters
public.help: Sets the filters for the displayObject.\n* IMPORTANT: This is a webGL only feature and will be ignored by the canvas renderer.\nTo remove filters simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: fixedToCamera
public.inlineHelp: Set to true to fix this Rope to the Camera at its current world coordinates.
public.help: A Rope that is fixed to the camera uses its x/y coordinates as offsets from the top left of the camera. These are stored in Rope.cameraOffset.\nNote that the cameraOffset values are in addition to any parent in the display list.\nSo if this Rope was in a Group that has x: 200, then this will be added to the cameraOffset.x

public.name: frame
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the current frame index and updates the Texture Cache for display.

public.name: frameName
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the current frame name and updates the Texture Cache for display.

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the currently running Game.

public.name: height
public.help: The height of the displayObjectContainer, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

public.name: hitArea
public.help: This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default.\nSetting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)

public.name: input
public.inlineHelp: The Input Handler for this object. Needs to be enabled with image.inputEnabled = true before you can use it.

public.name: inputEnabled
public.inlineHelp: Set to true to allow this object to receive input events.
public.help: By default a Rope won't process any input events at all. By setting inputEnabled to true the Phaser.InputHandler is\nactivated for this object and it will then start to process click/touch events and more.

public.name: interactive
public.help: Indicates if the sprite will have touch and mouse interactivity. It is false by default

public.name: key
public.inlineHelp: This is the image or texture used by the Sprite during rendering. It can be a string which is a reference to the Cache entry, or an instance of a RenderTexture, BitmapData or PIXI.Texture.

public.name: mask
public.help: Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it.\nIn PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping.\nTo remove a mask, set this property to null.

public.name: name
public.inlineHelp: The user defined name given to this Sprite.

public.name: padding
public.help: if you need a padding, not yet implemented

public.name: parent
public.help: [read-only] The display object container that contains this display object.

public.name: pivot
public.help: The pivot point of the displayObject that it rotates around

public.name: position
public.help: The coordinate of the object relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

public.name: renderable
public.help: Can this object be rendered

public.name: rotation
public.help: The rotation of the object in radians.

public.name: scale
public.help: The scale factor of the object.

public.name: stage
public.help: [read-only] The stage the display object is connected to, or undefined if it is not connected to the stage.

public.name: texture
public.help: The texture of the strip

public.name: type
public.inlineHelp: The const type of this object.

public.name: updateAnimation
public.inlineHelp: Returns an array of Phaser.Rectangles that represent the segments of the given rope
public.help: The segments that make up the rope body as an array of Phaser.Rectangles

public.name: visible
public.help: The visibility of the object.

public.name: width
public.help: The width of the displayObjectContainer, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

public.name: world
public.inlineHelp: The world coordinates of this Sprite. This differs from the x/y coordinates which are relative to the Sprites container.

public.name: worldAlpha
public.help: [read-only] The multiplied alpha of the displayObject

public.name: worldVisible
public.help: [read-only] Indicates if the sprite is globally visible.

public.name: x
public.inlineHelp: The position of the Rope on the x axis relative to the local coordinates of the parent.
public.help: The position of the Rope on the x axis relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

public.name: y
public.inlineHelp: The position of the Rope on the y axis relative to the local coordinates of the parent.
public.help: The position of the Rope on the y axis relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

public.name: z
public.inlineHelp: The z-depth value of this object within its Group (remember the World is a Group as well). No two objects in a Group can have the same z value.

private.name: _cache
private.help:
A small internal cache:
0 = previous position.x
1 = previous position.y
2 = previous rotation
3 = renderID
4 = fresh? (0 = no, 1 = yes)
5 = outOfBoundsFired (0 = no, 1 = yes)
6 = exists (0 = no, 1 = yes)
7 = fixed to camera (0 = no, 1 = yes)
8 = destroy phase? (0 = no, 1 = yes)

class.help: A Rope is a Sprite that has a repeating texture. The texture can be scrolled and scaled and will automatically wrap on the edges as it does so.\nPlease note that Ropes, as with normal Sprites, have no input handler or physics bodies by default. Both need enabling.\nExample usage: https://github.com/codevinsky/phaser-rope-demo/blob/master/dist/demo.js

parameters.name: game
parameters.help: A reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: x

parameters.help: The y coordinate (in world space) to position the Rope at.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: This is the image or texture used by the Rope during rendering. It can be a string which is a reference to the Cache entry, or an instance of a RenderTexture or PIXI.Texture.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.help: If this Rope is using part of a sprite sheet or texture atlas you can specify the exact frame to use by giving a string or numeric index.

parameters.name: points
parameters.help: An array of {Phaser.Point}.

parameters.name: loop
parameters.help: Should the animation be looped after playback. If not provided the previously set loop value of the Animation is used.

parameters.name: killOnComplete
parameters.help: If set to true when the animation completes (only happens if loop=false) the parent Sprite will be killed.

returns.help: A reference to playing Animation instance.

The animation should previously have been added via sprite.animations.add()\nIf the requested animation is already playing this request will be ignored. If you need to reset an already running animation do so directly on the Animation object itself.

public.name: retroFont

parameters.name: font
parameters.help: The key of the image in the Game.Cache that the RetroFont will use.

parameters.name: characterWidth
parameters.help: The width of each character in the font set.

parameters.name: characterHeight
parameters.help: The height of each character in the font set.

parameters.name: chars
parameters.help: The characters used in the font set, in display order. You can use the TEXT_SET consts for common font set arrangements.

parameters.name: charsPerRow
parameters.help: The number of characters per row in the font set.

parameters.name: xSpacing
parameters.help: If the characters in the font set have horizontal spacing between them set the required amount here.

parameters.name: ySpacing
parameters.help: If the characters in the font set have vertical spacing between them set the required amount here.

parameters.name: xOffset
parameters.help: If the font set doesn't start at the top left of the given image, specify the X coordinate offset here.

parameters.name: yOffset
parameters.help: If the font set doesn't start at the top left of the given image, specify the Y coordinate offset here.

returns.help: The newly created RetroFont texture which can be applied to an Image or Sprite.

public.help:
Create a new RetroFont object to be used as a texture for an Image or Sprite and optionally add it to the Cache.
A RetroFont uses a bitmap which contains fixed with characters for the font set. You use character spacing to define the set.
If you need variable width character support then use a BitmapText object instead. The main difference between a RetroFont and a BitmapText
is that a RetroFont creates a single texture that you can apply to a game object, where-as a BitmapText creates one Sprite object per letter of text.
The texture can be asssigned or one or multiple images/sprites, but note that the text the RetroFont uses will be shared across them all,
i.e. if you need each Image to have different text in it, then you need to create multiple RetroFont objects.
