public.name: tilemap

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The key of the tilemap data as stored in the Cache. If you're creating a blank map either leave this parameter out or pass `null`.

parameters.name: tileWidth
parameters.help: The pixel width of a single map tile. If using CSV data you must specify this. Not required if using Tiled map data.

parameters.name: tileHeight
parameters.help: The pixel height of a single map tile. If using CSV data you must specify this. Not required if using Tiled map data.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width of the map in tiles. If this map is created from Tiled or CSV data you don't need to specify this.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height of the map in tiles. If this map is created from Tiled or CSV data you don't need to specify this.

public.help:
Creates a new Phaser.Tilemap object. The map can either be populated with data from a Tiled JSON file or from a CSV file.
To do this pass the Cache key as the first parameter. When using Tiled data you need only provide the key.
When using CSV data you must provide the key and the tileWidth and tileHeight parameters.
If creating a blank tilemap to be populated later, you can either specify no parameters at all and then use `Tilemap.create` or pass the map and tile dimensions here.
Note that all Tilemaps use a base tile size to calculate dimensions from, but that a TilemapLayer may have its own unique tile size that overrides it.

public.name: alive
public.inlineHelp: The alive property is useful for Groups that are children of other Groups and need to be included/excluded in checks like forEachAlive.

public.name: alpha
public.help: The opacity of the object.

public.name: angle
public.inlineHelp: The angle of rotation given in degrees, where 0 degrees = to the right.
public.help: The angle of rotation of the Group container. This will adjust the Group container itself by modifying its rotation.\nThis will have no impact on the rotation value of its children, but it will update their worldTransform and on-screen position.

public.name: buttonMode
public.help: This is used to indicate if the displayObject should display a mouse hand cursor on rollover

public.name: cacheAsBitmap
public.help: Set if this display object is cached as a bitmap.\nThis basically takes a snap shot of the display object as it is at that moment. It can provide a performance benefit for complex static displayObjects.\nTo remove simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: cameraOffset
public.inlineHelp: If this object is fixedToCamera then this stores the x/y offset that its drawn at, from the top-left of the camera view.

public.name: children
public.help: [read-only] The array of children of this container.

public.name: classType
public.help: The type of objects that will be created when you use Group.create or Group.createMultiple. Defaults to Phaser.Sprite.\nWhen a new object is created it is passed the following parameters to its constructor: game, x, y, key, frame.

public.name: cursor
public.inlineHelp: The current display object that the Group cursor is pointing to.
public.help: The cursor is a simple way to iterate through the objects in a Group using the Group.next and Group.previous functions.\nThe cursor is set to the first child added to the Group and doesn't change unless you call next, previous or set it directly with Group.cursor.

public.name: defaultCursor
public.help: This is the cursor that will be used when the mouse is over this object. To enable this the element must have interaction = true and buttonMode = true\n

public.name: enableBody
public.inlineHelp: If true all Sprites created by, or added to this Group, will have a physics body enabled on them. Change the body type with `Group.physicsBodyType`.

public.name: enableBodyDebug
public.inlineHelp: If true when a physics body is created (via Group.enableBody) it will create a physics debug object as well. Only works for P2 bodies.

public.name: exists
public.inlineHelp: If exists is true the Group is updated, otherwise it is skipped.

public.name: filterArea
public.help: The area the filter is applied to like the hitArea this is used as more of an optimisation\nrather than figuring out the dimensions of the displayObject each frame you can set this rectangle

public.name: filters
public.help: Sets the filters for the displayObject.\n* IMPORTANT: This is a webGL only feature and will be ignored by the canvas renderer.\nTo remove filters simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: fixedToCamera
public.inlineHelp: Set to true to fix this Group to the Camera at its current world coordinates.
public.help: A Group that is fixed to the camera uses its x/y coordinates as offsets from the top left of the camera. These are stored in Group.cameraOffset.\nNote that the cameraOffset values are in addition to any parent in the display list.\nSo if this Group was in a Group that has x: 200, then this will be added to the cameraOffset.x

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the currently running Game.

public.name: grid
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the FlexGrid that owns this layer.

public.name: height
public.help: The height of the displayObjectContainer, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

public.name: hitArea
public.help: This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default.\nSetting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)

public.name: ignoreDestroy
public.inlineHelp: A Group with `ignoreDestroy` set to `true` ignores all calls to its `destroy` method.

public.name: interactive
public.help: Indicates if the sprite will have touch and mouse interactivity. It is false by default

public.name: length
public.inlineHelp: The total number of children in this Group, regardless of their exists/alive status.

public.name: mask
public.help: Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it.\nIn PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping.\nTo remove a mask, set this property to null.

public.name: name
public.inlineHelp: A name for this Group. Not used internally but useful for debugging.

public.name: onDestroy
public.inlineHelp: This signal is dispatched when the parent is destoyed.

public.name: parent
public.inlineHelp: The parent of this Group.

public.name: physicsBodyType
public.inlineHelp: If Group.enableBody is true this is the type of physics body that is created on new Sprites. Phaser.Physics.ARCADE, Phaser.Physics.P2, Phaser.Physics.NINJA, etc.

public.name: pivot
public.inlineHelp: The pivot point of the Group container.

public.name: position
public.help: The coordinate of the object relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

public.name: renderable
public.help: Can this object be rendered

public.name: rotation
public.inlineHelp: The angle of rotation given in radians.
public.help: The angle of rotation of the Group container. This will adjust the Group container itself by modifying its rotation.\nThis will have no impact on the rotation value of its children, but it will update their worldTransform and on-screen position.

public.name: scale
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the ScaleManager.

public.name: stage
public.help: [read-only] The stage the display object is connected to, or undefined if it is not connected to the stage.

public.name: total
public.inlineHelp: The total number of children in this Group who have a state of exists = true.

public.name: visible
public.inlineHelp: The visible state of the Group. Non-visible Groups and all of their children are not rendered.

public.name: width
public.help: The width of the displayObjectContainer, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

public.name: worldAlpha
public.help: [read-only] The multiplied alpha of the displayObject

public.name: worldVisible
public.help: [read-only] Indicates if the sprite is globally visible.

public.name: x
public.inlineHelp: The x coordinate of the Group container.
public.help: The x coordinate of the Group container. You can adjust the Group container itself by modifying its coordinates.\nThis will have no impact on the x/y coordinates of its children, but it will update their worldTransform and on-screen position.

public.name: y
public.inlineHelp: The y coordinate of the Group container.
public.help: The y coordinate of the Group container. You can adjust the Group container itself by modifying its coordinates.\nThis will have no impact on the x/y coordinates of its children, but it will update their worldTransform and on-screen position.

public.name: z
public.inlineHelp: The z-depth value of this object within its Group (remember the World is a Group as well). No two objects in a Group can have the same z value.

class.help:
WARNING: This is an EXPERIMENTAL class. The API will change significantly in the coming versions and is incomplete.
Please try to avoid using in production games with a long time to build.
This is also why the documentation is incomplete.

A responsive grid layer.

public.name: add

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: An instance of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the child will not dispatch the onAddedToGroup event.

returns.help: The child that was added to the Group.

public.help: Adds an existing object to this Group. The object can be an instance of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object.\nThe child is automatically added to the top of the Group, so renders on-top of everything else within the Group. If you need to control\nthat then see the addAt method.

public.name: addAll

parameters.name: property
parameters.help: The property to increment, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.help: The amount to increment the property by. If child.x = 10 then addAll('x', 40) would make child.x = 50.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

public.help: Adds the amount to the given property on all children in this Group.\nGroup.addAll('x', 10) will add 10 to the child.x value.

public.name: addAt

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: An instance of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object..

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index within the Group to insert the child to.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the child will not dispatch the onAddedToGroup event.

returns.help: The child that was added to the Group.

public.help: Adds an existing object to this Group. The object can be an instance of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object.\nThe child is added to the Group at the location specified by the index value, this allows you to control child ordering.

public.name: addChild

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The DisplayObject to add to the container

returns.help: The child that was added.

public.help: Adds a child to the container.

parameters.help: The child to add

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index to place the child in

returns.help: The child that was added.

public.help: Adds a child to the container at a specified index. If the index is out of bounds an error will be thrown

public.name: addMultiple

parameters.name: children
parameters.help: An array containing instances of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the children will not dispatch the onAddedToGroup event.

returns.help: The array of children that were added to the Group.

public.help: Adds an array existing objects to this Group. The objects can be instances of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object.\nThe children are automatically added to the top of the Group, so render on-top of everything else within the Group.\nTODO: Add ability to pass the children as parameters rather than having to be an array.

parameters.help: The child to bring to the top of this Group.

returns.help: The child that was moved.

public.help: Brings the given child to the top of this Group so it renders above all other children.

public.name: callAll

parameters.name: method
parameters.help: A string containing the name of the function that will be called. The function must exist on the child.

parameters.name: context
parameters.help: A string containing the context under which the method will be executed. Set to null to default to the child.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.help: Additional parameters that will be passed to the method.

public.help: Calls a function on all of the children regardless if they are dead or alive (see callAllExists if you need control over that)\nAfter the method parameter and context you can add as many extra parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child.

public.name: callAllExists

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that exists on the children that will be called.

parameters.name: existsValue
parameters.help: Only children with exists=existsValue will be called.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.help: Additional parameters that will be passed to the callback.

public.help: Calls a function on all of the children that have exists=true in this Group.\nAfter the existsValue parameter you can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child callback.

public.name: checkAll

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be checked.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If set then only children with alive=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If set then only children with visible=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.

public.help: This function allows you to quickly check that the same property across all children of this Group is equal to the given value.\nThis call doesn't descend down children, so if you have a Group inside of this Group, the property will be checked on the Group but not its children.

public.name: checkProperty

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to check the property value on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: An array of strings that make up the property that will be set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be checked.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.

returns.help: True if the property was was equal to value, false if not.

public.help: Checks a property for the given value on the child.

public.name: click
public.help: A callback that is used when the users clicks on the displayObject with their mouse's left button

public.name: countDead

returns.help: The number of children flagged as dead.

public.help: Call this function to find out how many members of the group are dead.

public.name: countLiving

returns.help: The number of children flagged as alive.

public.help: Call this function to find out how many members of the group are alive.

public.name: create

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: The x coordinate to display the newly created Sprite at. The value is in relation to the Group.x point.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The y coordinate to display the newly created Sprite at. The value is in relation to the Group.y point.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.help: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.

parameters.name: exists
parameters.help: The default exists state of the Sprite.

returns.help: The child that was created. Will be a Phaser.Sprite unless Group.classType has been changed.

public.help: Automatically creates a new Phaser.Sprite object and adds it to the top of this Group.\nYou can change Group.classType to any object and this call will create an object of that type instead, but it should extend either Sprite or Image.

public.name: createMultiple

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.help: The number of Sprites to create.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.help: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.

parameters.name: exists
parameters.help: The default exists state of the Sprite.

public.help:
Automatically creates multiple Phaser.Sprite objects and adds them to the top of this Group.
Useful if you need to quickly generate a pool of identical sprites, such as bullets. By default the sprites will be set to not exist
and will be positioned at 0, 0 (relative to the Group.x/y)
You can change Group.classType to any object and this call will create an object of that type instead, but it should extend either Sprite or Image.

public.name: customSort

parameters.name: sortHandler
parameters.help: Your sort handler function. It will be sent two parameters: the two children involved in the comparison. It must return -1, 1 or 0.

parameters.name: context
parameters.help: The scope in which the sortHandler is called.

public.help: This allows you to use your own sort handler function.\nIt will be sent two parameters: the two children involved in the comparison (a and b). It should return -1 if a > b, 1 if a < b or 0 if a === b.

public.name: descendingSortHandler

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The first object being sorted.

parameters.name: b
parameters.help: The second object being sorted.

public.help: An internal helper function for the sort process.

public.name: destroy

parameters.name: destroyChildren
parameters.help: Should every child of this Group have its destroy method called?

parameters.name: soft
parameters.help: A 'soft destroy' (set to true) doesn't remove this Group from its parent or null the game reference. Set to false and it does.

public.help: Destroys this Group. Removes all children, then removes the container from the display list and nulls references.

public.name: divideAll

parameters.name: property
parameters.help: The property to divide, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.help: The amount to divide the property by. If child.x = 100 then divideAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 50.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

public.help: Divides the given property by the amount on all children in this Group.\nGroup.divideAll('x', 2) will half the child.x value.

public.name: filter

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.help: The function that each child will be evaluated against. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter, the index as the second, and the entire child array as the third

parameters.name: checkExists
parameters.help: If set only children with exists=true will be passed to the callback, otherwise all children will be passed.

returns.help: Returns an array list containing all the children that the predicate returned true for

public.name: forEach

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that will be called. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

parameters.name: checkExists
parameters.help: If set only children with exists=true will be passed to the callback, otherwise all children will be passed.

public.help:
Allows you to call your own function on each member of this Group. You must pass the callback and context in which it will run.
After the checkExists parameter you can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child.
For example: Group.forEach(awardBonusGold, this, true, 100, 500)
Note: Currently this will skip any children which are Groups themselves.

public.name: forEachAlive

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that will be called. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

public.help: Allows you to call your own function on each alive member of this Group (where child.alive=true). You must pass the callback and context in which it will run.\nYou can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child.\nFor example: Group.forEachAlive(causeDamage, this, 500)

public.name: forEachDead

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that will be called. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

public.help: Allows you to call your own function on each dead member of this Group (where alive=false). You must pass the callback and context in which it will run.\nYou can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child.\nFor example: Group.forEachDead(bringToLife, this)

public.name: forEachExists

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that will be called. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

public.help: Allows you to call your own function on each member of this Group where child.exists=true. You must pass the callback and context in which it will run.\nYou can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child.\nFor example: Group.forEachExists(causeDamage, this, 500)

parameters.name: renderer
parameters.help: The renderer used to generate the texture.

returns.help: a texture of the graphics object

public.name: getAt

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index to return the child from.

returns.help: The child that was found at the given index. If the index was out of bounds then this will return -1.

returns.help: The child at the bottom of the Group.

public.help: Returns the child at the bottom of this Group. The bottom is the one being displayed (rendered) below every other child.

returns.help: The rectangular bounding area

public.help: Retrieves the bounds of the displayObjectContainer as a rectangle. The bounds calculation takes all visible children into consideration.

returns.help: The index position of the child display object to identify

public.help: Returns the index position of a child DisplayObject instance

returns.help: The first alive child, or null if none found.

public.help: Call this function to retrieve the first object with alive === true in the group.\nThis is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

public.name: getFirstDead

returns.help: The first dead child, or null if none found.

public.help: Call this function to retrieve the first object with alive === false in the group.\nThis is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

public.name: getFirstExists

parameters.name: state
parameters.help: True or false.

returns.help: The first child, or null if none found.

public.help: Call this function to retrieve the first object with exists == (the given state) in the Group.

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to get the index for.

returns.help: The index of the child or -1 if it's not a member of this Group.

public.help: Get the index position of the given child in this Group. This should always match the childs z property.

public.name: getLocalBounds

returns.help: The rectangular bounding area

public.help: Retrieves the non-global local bounds of the displayObjectContainer as a rectangle. The calculation takes all visible children into consideration.

public.name: getRandom

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.help: Optional offset off the front of the array. Default value is 0, or the beginning of the array.

parameters.name: length
parameters.help: Optional restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.

returns.help: A random child of this Group.

public.help: Returns a member at random from the group.

public.name: getTop

returns.help: The child at the top of the Group.

public.help: Returns the child at the top of this Group. The top is the one being displayed (rendered) above every other child.

public.name: hasProperty

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to check for the existance of the property on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: An array of strings that make up the property.

returns.help: True if the child has the property, otherwise false.

public.help: Checks if the child has the given property. Will scan up to 4 levels deep only.

public.name: iterate

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The child property to check, i.e. 'exists', 'alive', 'health'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: If child.key === this value it will be considered a match. Note that a strict comparison is used.

parameters.name: returnType
parameters.help: How to return the data from this method. Either Phaser.Group.RETURN_NONE, Phaser.Group.RETURN_TOTAL or Phaser.Group.RETURN_CHILD.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: Optional function that will be called on each matching child. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

returns.help: Returns either a numeric total (if RETURN_TOTAL was specified) or the child object.

public.help: Iterates over the children of the Group. When a child has a property matching key that equals the given value, it is considered as a match.\nMatched children can be sent to the optional callback, or simply returned or counted.\nYou can add as many callback parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child, after the callbackContext parameter.

public.name: mousedown
public.help: A callback that is used when the user clicks the mouse's left button down over the sprite

public.name: mouseout
public.help: A callback that is used when the users mouse leaves the displayObject

public.name: mouseover
public.help: A callback that is used when the users mouse rolls over the displayObject

public.name: mouseup
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's left button that was over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired, the mouse's left button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

public.name: mouseupoutside
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's left button that was over the displayObject but is no longer over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired, the mouse's left button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

returns.help: The child that was moved.

parameters.help: The amount to multiply the property by. If child.x = 10 then multiplyAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 20.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

public.help: Multiplies the given property by the amount on all children in this Group.\nGroup.multiplyAll('x', 2) will x2 the child.x value.

public.name: next

returns.help: The child the cursor now points to.

public.help: Advances the Group cursor to the next object in the Group. If it's at the end of the Group it wraps around to the first object.

public.name: previous

returns.help: The child the cursor now points to.

public.help: Moves the Group cursor to the previous object in the Group. If it's at the start of the Group it wraps around to the last object.

public.name: remove

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to remove.

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.help: You can optionally call destroy on the child that was removed.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the child will not dispatch the onRemovedFromGroup event.

returns.help: true if the child was removed from this Group, otherwise false.

public.help: Removes the given child from this Group. This will dispatch an onRemovedFromGroup event from the child (if it has one),\nreset the Group cursor and optionally destroy the child.

public.name: removeAll

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.help: You can optionally call destroy on each child that is removed.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the children will not dispatch their onRemovedFromGroup events.

public.name: removeBetween

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.help: The index to start removing children from.

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.help: The index to stop removing children at. Must be higher than startIndex. If undefined this method will remove all children between startIndex and the end of the Group.

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.help: You can optionally call destroy on the child that was removed.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the children will not dispatch their onRemovedFromGroup events.

public.help: Removes all children from this Group whos index falls beteen the given startIndex and endIndex values.

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The DisplayObject to remove

returns.help: The child that was removed.

parameters.help: The index to get the child from

parameters.name: endIndex

parameters.name: newChild
parameters.help: The child to be inserted into this Group.

returns.help: Returns the oldChild that was replaced within this Group.

parameters.name: index

returns.help: The child the cursor now points to.

public.help: Reverses all children in this Group. Note that this does not propagate, only direct children are re-ordered.

public.help: A callback that is used when the users clicks on the displayObject with their mouse's right button

public.help: A callback that is used when the user clicks the mouse's right button down over the sprite

public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's right button that was over the displayObject but is no longer over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired, the mouse's right button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to send to the bottom of this Group.

returns.help: The child that was moved.

public.help: Sends the given child to the bottom of this Group so it renders below all other children.

public.name: set

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to set the property on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If set then the child will only be updated if alive=true.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If set then the child will only be updated if visible=true.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.help: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

returns.help: True if the property was set, false if not.

public.help: This function allows you to quickly set a property on a single child of this Group to a new value.\nThe operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

public.name: setAll

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If set then only children with alive=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If set then only children with visible=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.help: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

public.help:
This function allows you to quickly set the same property across all children of this Group to a new value.
This call doesn't descend down children, so if you have a Group inside of this Group, the property will be set on the Group but not its children.
If you need that ability please see `Group.setAllChildren`.

The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

public.name: setAllChildren

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If set then only children with alive=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If set then only children with visible=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.help: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

public.help:
This function allows you to quickly set the same property across all children of this Group, and any child Groups, to a new value.

If this Group contains other Groups then the same property is set across their children as well, iterating down until it reaches the bottom.
Unlike with Group.setAll the property is NOT set on child Groups itself.

The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

public.name: setChildIndex

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child DisplayObject instance for which you want to change the index number

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The resulting index number for the child display object

public.help: Changes the position of an existing child in the display object container

public.name: setProperty

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to set the property value on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: An array of strings that make up the property that will be set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.help: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

returns.help: True if the property was set, false if not.

public.help:
Sets a property to the given value on the child. The operation parameter controls how the value is set.
Operation 0 means set the existing value to the given value, or if force is `false` create a new property with the given value.
1 will add the given value to the value already present.
2 will subtract the given value from the value already present.
3 will multiply the value already present by the given value.
4 will divide the value already present by the given value.

public.name: setStageReference

parameters.name: stage
parameters.help: the stage that the container will have as its current stage reference

public.help: Sets the containers Stage reference. This is the Stage that this object, and all of its children, is connected to.

parameters.name: order

public.help: Call this function to sort the group according to a particular value and order.\nFor example to depth sort Sprites for Zelda-style game you might call `group.sort('y', Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING)` at the bottom of your `State.update()`.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

public.help: Subtracts the amount from the given property on all children in this Group.\nGroup.subAll('x', 10) will minus 10 from the child.x value.

parameters.name: font
parameters.help: The key of the image in the Game.Cache that the RetroFont will use.

parameters.help: The width of each character in the font set.

parameters.help: If the characters in the font set have horizontal spacing between them set the required amount here.

parameters.name: ySpacing
parameters.help: If the characters in the font set have vertical spacing between them set the required amount here.

parameters.name: xOffset
parameters.help: If the font set doesn't start at the top left of the given image, specify the X coordinate offset here.

parameters.name: yOffset
parameters.help: If the font set doesn't start at the top left of the given image, specify the Y coordinate offset here.

returns.help: The newly created RetroFont texture which can be applied to an Image or Sprite.

public.help:
Create a new RetroFont object to be used as a texture for an Image or Sprite and optionally add it to the Cache.
A RetroFont uses a bitmap which contains fixed with characters for the font set. You use character spacing to define the set.
If you need variable width character support then use a BitmapText object instead. The main difference between a RetroFont and a BitmapText
is that a RetroFont creates a single texture that you can apply to a game object, where-as a BitmapText creates one Sprite object per letter of text.
The texture can be asssigned or one or multiple images/sprites, but note that the text the RetroFont uses will be shared across them all,
i.e. if you need each Image to have different text in it, then you need to create multiple RetroFont objects.

parameters.help: The key of the tilemap data as stored in the Cache. If you're creating a blank map either leave this parameter out or pass `null`.

parameters.name: tileWidth
parameters.help: The pixel width of a single map tile. If using CSV data you must specify this. Not required if using Tiled map data.

parameters.name: tileHeight
parameters.help: The pixel height of a single map tile. If using CSV data you must specify this. Not required if using Tiled map data.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width of the map in tiles. If this map is created from Tiled or CSV data you don't need to specify this.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height of the map in tiles. If this map is created from Tiled or CSV data you don't need to specify this.

returns.help: The newly created tilemap object.

public.help:
Creates a new Phaser.Tilemap object. The map can either be populated with data from a Tiled JSON file or from a CSV file.
To do this pass the Cache key as the first parameter. When using Tiled data you need only provide the key.
When using CSV data you must provide the key and the tileWidth and tileHeight parameters.
If creating a blank tilemap to be populated later, you can either specify no parameters at all and then use `Tilemap.create` or pass the map and tile dimensions here.
Note that all Tilemaps use a base tile size to calculate dimensions from, but that a TilemapLayer may have its own unique tile size that overrides it.

public.help: Post-render is called after the Game Renderer and State.render have run.\nIt only calls plugins who have visible=true.

public.name: postUpdate
public.help: PostUpdate is the last thing to be called before the world render.\nIn particular, it is called after the world postUpdate, which means the camera has been adjusted.\nIt only calls plugins who have active=true.

public.name: preUpdate
public.help: Pre-update is called at the very start of the update cycle, before any other subsystems have been updated (including Physics).\nIt only calls plugins who have active=true.

public.name: removeAll
public.help: Remove all Plugins from the PluginManager. It calls Plugin.destroy on every plugin before removing it from the manager.

public.name: render
public.help: Render is called right after the Game Renderer completes, but before the State.render.\nIt only calls plugins who have visible=true.

public.name: update
public.help: Update is called after all the core subsystems (Input, Tweens, Sound, etc) and the State have updated, but before the render.\nIt only calls plugins who have active=true.

class.help:
A Class that loads a bunch of images / sprite sheet / bitmap font files. Once the
assets have been loaded they are added to the PIXI Texture cache and can be accessed
easily through PIXI.Texture.fromImage() and PIXI.Sprite.fromImage()
When all items have been loaded this class will dispatch a 'onLoaded' event
As each individual item is loaded this class will dispatch a 'onProgress' event

supported. Supported image formats include 'jpeg', 'jpg', 'png', 'gif'. Supported
sprite sheet data formats only include 'JSON' at this time. Supported bitmap font
data formats include 'xml' and 'fnt'.

class.help: An Animation instance contains a single animation and the controls to play it.\nIt is created by the AnimationManager, consists of Animation.Frame objects and belongs to a single Game Object such as a Sprite.

parameters.help: The FrameData object that contains all frames used by this Animation.

parameters.help: An array of numbers or strings indicating which frames to play in which order.

parameters.name: frameRate
parameters.help: The speed at which the animation should play. The speed is given in frames per second.

parameters.name: loop
parameters.help: Whether or not the animation is looped or just plays once.

parameters.name: loop
parameters.help: Should this animation loop when it reaches the end or play through once.

parameters.name: stop
parameters.help: The number to count to. If your frames are named 'explosion_0001' to 'explosion_0034' the stop value is 34.

parameters.name: suffix
parameters.help: The end of the filename. If the filename was 'explosion_0001-large' the prefix would be '-large'.

parameters.name: zeroPad

returns.help: An array of framenames.

public.help: Really handy function for when you are creating arrays of animation data but it's using frame names and not numbers.\nFor example imagine you've got 30 frames named: 'explosion_0001-large' to 'explosion_0030-large'\nYou could use this function to generate those by doing: Phaser.Animation.generateFrameNames('explosion_', 1, 30, '-large', 4);

public.name: fullScreenTarget
public.help: This is the DOM element that will have the Full Screen mode called on it. It defaults to the game canvas, but can be retargetted to any valid DOM element.\nIf you adjust this property it's up to you to see it has the correct CSS applied, and that you have contained the game canvas correctly.\nNote that if you use a scale property of EXACT_FIT then fullScreenTarget will have its width and height style set to 100%.

public.name: maxWidth

public.name: onResizeContext

public.name: orientation
public.inlineHelp: The orientation value of the game (as defined by window.orientation if set). 90 = landscape. 0 = portrait.

public.name: pageAlignHorizontally
public.inlineHelp: If you wish to align your game in the middle of the page then you can set this value to true.
public.help: It will place a re-calculated margin-left pixel value onto the canvas element which is updated on orientation/resizing events.\nIt doesn't care about any other DOM element that may be on the page, it literally just sets the margin.

public.name: pageAlignVertically
public.inlineHelp: If you wish to align your game in the middle of the page then you can set this value to true.
public.help: It will place a re-calculated margin-left pixel value onto the canvas element which is updated on orientation/resizing events.\nIt doesn't care about any other DOM element that may be on the page, it literally just sets the margin.

public.name: parentIsWindow
public.inlineHelp: If the parent container of the game is the browser window, rather than a div, this is set to `true`.

public.name: parentNode
public.inlineHelp: The fully parsed parent container of the game. If the parent is the browser window this will be `null`.

public.name: parentScaleFactor
public.inlineHelp: The scale of the game in relation to its parent container.

public.name: clearBeforeRender
public.help:
This sets if the CanvasRenderer will clear the canvas or not before the new render pass.
If the Stage is NOT transparent Pixi will use a canvas sized fillRect operation every frame to set the canvas background color.
If the Stage is transparent Pixi will use clearRect to clear the canvas every frame.
Disable this by setting this to false. For example if your game has a canvas filling background image you often don't need this set.

protected.name: data
protected.inlineHelp: The p2 Body data.

public.name: DYNAMIC
public.help: Dynamic body. Dynamic bodies body can move and respond to collisions and forces.

public.name: KINEMATIC
public.help: Kinematic body. Kinematic bodies only moves according to its .velocity, and does not respond to collisions or force.

public.name: STATIC
public.help: Static body. Static bodies do not move, and they do not respond to forces or collision.

public.name: angle
public.inlineHelp: The angle of this Body in degrees.
public.help: The angle of the Body in degrees from its original orientation. Values from 0 to 180 represent clockwise rotation; values from 0 to -180 represent counterclockwise rotation.\nValues outside this range are added to or subtracted from 360 to obtain a value within the range. For example, the statement Body.angle = 450 is the same as Body.angle = 90.\nIf you wish to work in radians instead of degrees use the property Body.rotation instead. Working in radians is faster as it doesn't have to convert values.

public.name: angularDamping
public.inlineHelp: The angular damping acting acting on the body.
public.help: Damping is specified as a value between 0 and 1, which is the proportion of velocity lost per second.

public.name: angularForce
public.inlineHelp: The angular force acting on the body.

public.name: angularVelocity
public.inlineHelp: The angular velocity of the body.

public.name: collideWorldBounds
public.inlineHelp: Should the Body collide with the World bounds?
public.help:
A Body can be set to collide against the World bounds automatically if this is set to true. Otherwise it will leave the World.
Note that this only applies if your World has bounds! The response to the collision should be managed via CollisionMaterials.
Also note that when you set this it will only effect Body shapes that already exist. If you then add further shapes to your Body
after setting this it will *not* proactively set them to collide with the bounds.

public.name: collidesWith
public.inlineHelp: Array of CollisionGroups that this Bodies shapes collide with.

public.name: damping
public.inlineHelp: The linear damping acting on the body in the velocity direction.
public.help: Damping is specified as a value between 0 and 1, which is the proportion of velocity lost per second.

public.name: debug
public.inlineHelp: Enable or disable debug drawing of this body

public.name: debugBody
public.inlineHelp: Reference to the debug body.

public.name: dynamic
public.inlineHelp: Returns true if the Body is dynamic. Setting Body.dynamic to 'false' will make it static.

public.name: force
public.inlineHelp: The force applied to the body.

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: Local reference to game.

public.name: gravity
public.inlineHelp: A locally applied gravity force to the Body. Applied directly before the world step. NOTE: Not currently implemented.

public.name: id
public.inlineHelp: The Body ID. Each Body that has been added to the World has a unique ID.

public.name: inertia
public.inlineHelp: The inertia of the body around the Z axis..

public.name: kinematic
public.inlineHelp: Returns true if the Body is kinematic. Setting Body.kinematic to 'false' will make it static.

public.name: motionState
public.inlineHelp: The type of motion this body has. Should be one of: Body.STATIC (the body does not move), Body.DYNAMIC (body can move and respond to collisions) and Body.KINEMATIC (only moves according to its .velocity).

public.name: offset
public.inlineHelp: The offset of the Physics Body from the Sprite x/y position.

public.name: onBeginContact
public.help: Dispatched when a first contact is created between shapes in two bodies. This event is fired during the step, so collision has already taken place.\nThe event will be sent 4 parameters: The body it is in contact with, the shape from this body that caused the contact, the shape from the contact body and the contact equation data array.

public.name: onEndContact
public.help: Dispatched when contact ends between shapes in two bodies. This event is fired during the step, so collision has already taken place.\nThe event will be sent 3 parameters: The body it is in contact with, the shape from this body that caused the contact and the shape from the contact body.

public.name: removeNextStep
public.inlineHelp: To avoid deleting this body during a physics step, and causing all kinds of problems, set removeNextStep to true to have it removed in the next preUpdate.

public.name: rotation
public.inlineHelp: The angle of this Body in radians.
public.help: The angle of the Body in radians.\nIf you wish to work in degrees instead of radians use the Body.angle property instead. Working in radians is faster as it doesn't have to convert values.

public.name: sprite
public.inlineHelp: Reference to the parent Sprite.

public.name: static
public.inlineHelp: Returns true if the Body is static. Setting Body.static to 'false' will make it dynamic.

public.name: type
public.inlineHelp: The type of physics system this body belongs to.

public.name: velocity
public.inlineHelp: The velocity of the body. Set velocity.x to a negative value to move to the left, position to the right. velocity.y negative values move up, positive move down.

public.name: world
public.inlineHelp: Local reference to the P2 World.

public.name: x
public.inlineHelp: The x coordinate of this Body.

public.name: y
public.inlineHelp: The y coordinate of this Body.

private.name: _collideWorldBounds
private.inlineHelp: Internal var that determines if this Body collides with the world bounds or not.

class.help:
The Physics Body is typically linked to a single Sprite and defines properties that determine how the physics body is simulated.
These properties affect how the body reacts to forces, what forces it generates on itself (to simulate friction), and how it reacts to collisions in the scene.
In most cases, the properties are used to simulate physical effects. Each body also has its own property values that determine exactly how it reacts to forces and collisions in the scene.
By default a single Rectangle shape is added to the Body that matches the dimensions of the parent Sprite. See addShape, removeShape, clearShapes to add extra shapes around the Body.
Note: When bound to a Sprite to avoid single-pixel jitters on mobile devices we strongly recommend using Sprite sizes that are even on both axis, i.e. 128x128 not 127x127.
Note: When a game object is given a P2 body it has its anchor x/y set to 0.5, so it becomes centered.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The y coordinate of this Body.

parameters.name: mass
parameters.help: The default mass of this Body (0 = static).

public.name: addPolygon

parameters.name: options
parameters.help: An object containing the build options:

parameters.name: options.optimalDecomp
parameters.help: Set to true if you need optimal decomposition. Warning: very slow for polygons with more than 10 vertices.

parameters.name: options.skipSimpleCheck
parameters.help: Set to true if you already know that the path is not intersecting itself.

parameters.name: options.removeCollinearPoints
parameters.help: Set to a number (angle threshold value) to remove collinear points, or false to keep all points.

parameters.name: points
parameters.help: An array of 2d vectors that form the convex or concave polygon.

returns.help: True on success, else false.

public.help:
Reads a polygon shape path, and assembles convex shapes from that and puts them at proper offset points. The shape must be simple and without holes.
This function expects the x.y values to be given in pixels. If you want to provide them at p2 world scales then call Body.data.fromPolygon directly.

Either [[0,0], [0,1],...] or a flat array of numbers that will be interpreted as [x,y, x,y, ...],
or the arguments passed can be flat x,y values e.g. `setPolygon(options, x,y, x,y, x,y, ...)` where `x` and `y` are numbers.

public.name: createBodyCallback

parameters.name: object
parameters.help: The object to send impact events for.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The callback to fire on impact. Set to null to clear a previously set callback.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context under which the callback will fire.

public.help:
Sets a callback to be fired any time a shape in this Body impacts with a shape in the given Body. The impact test is performed against body.id values.
The callback will be sent 4 parameters: This body, the body that impacted, the Shape in this body and the shape in the impacting body.
Note that the impact event happens after collision resolution, so it cannot be used to prevent a collision from happening.
It also happens mid-step. So do not destroy a Body during this callback, instead set safeDestroy to true so it will be killed on the next preUpdate.

public.name: createGroupCallback

parameters.name: group
parameters.help: The Group to send impact events for.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The callback to fire on impact. Set to null to clear a previously set callback.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context under which the callback will fire.

public.help:
Sets a callback to be fired any time this Body impacts with the given Group. The impact test is performed against shape.collisionGroup values.
The callback will be sent 4 parameters: This body, the body that impacted, the Shape in this body and the shape in the impacting body.
This callback will only fire if this Body has been assigned a collision group.
Note that the impact event happens after collision resolution, so it cannot be used to prevent a collision from happening.
It also happens mid-step. So do not destroy a Body during this callback, instead set safeDestroy to true so it will be killed on the next preUpdate.

public.inlineHelp: The crossOrigin value applied to loaded images. Very often this needs to be set to 'anonymous'.

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: Local reference to game.

public.name: hasLoaded
public.inlineHelp: True if all assets in the queue have finished loading.

public.name: isLoading
public.inlineHelp: True if the Loader is in the process of loading the queue.

public.name: onFileComplete
public.inlineHelp: This event is dispatched when a file completes loading successfully.

public.name: onFileError
public.inlineHelp: This event is dispatched when a file errors as a result of the load request.

public.name: onFileStart
public.inlineHelp: This event is dispatched immediately before a file starts loading. It's possible the file may still error (404, etc) after this event is sent.

public.name: onLoadComplete
public.inlineHelp: This event is dispatched when the final file in the load queue has either loaded or failed.

public.name: onLoadStart
public.inlineHelp: This event is dispatched when the loading process starts, before the first file has been requested.

public.name: onPackComplete
public.inlineHelp: This event is dispatched when an asset pack has either loaded or failed.

public.name: preloadSprite
public.help: You can optionally link a sprite to the preloader.\nIf you do so the Sprites width or height will be cropped based on the percentage loaded.\nThis property is an object containing: sprite, rect, direction, width and height

public.name: progress
public.inlineHelp: The rounded load progress percentage value (from 0 to 100)

public.name: progressFloat
public.inlineHelp: The non-rounded load progress value (from 0.0 to 100.0)

public.name: useXDomainRequest
public.inlineHelp: If true and if the browser supports XDomainRequest, it will be used in preference for xhr when loading json files. It is enabled automatically if the browser is IE9, but you can disable it as required.

private.inlineHelp: An ajax request used specifically by IE9 for CORs loading issues.

private.name: _fileIndex
private.inlineHelp: The index of the current file being loaded.

private.name: _fileList
private.inlineHelp: Contains all the assets file infos.

private.name: _packIndex
private.inlineHelp: The index of the current asset pack.

private.name: _progressChunk
private.inlineHelp: Indicates the size of 1 file in terms of a percentage out of 100.

protected.inlineHelp: A local array of all created Materials.

public.name: applyDamping
public.inlineHelp: Enable to automatically apply body damping each step.

public.name: applyGravity
public.inlineHelp: Enable to automatically apply gravity each step.

public.name: applySpringForces
public.inlineHelp: Enable to automatically apply spring forces each step.

public.inlineHelp: An array of the bodies the world bounds collides with.

public.name: boundsCollisionGroup
public.inlineHelp: A default collision group.

public.name: callbackContext
public.inlineHelp: The context under which the callbacks are fired.

public.name: collisionGroups
public.inlineHelp: An array containing the collision groups that have been defined in the World.

public.name: contactMaterial
public.inlineHelp: The default Contact Material being used by the World.

public.name: emitImpactEvent
public.inlineHelp: Set to true if you want to the world to emit the "impact" event. Turning this off could improve performance.

public.name: everythingCollisionGroup
public.inlineHelp: A default collision group.

public.name: frameRate
public.inlineHelp: The frame rate the world will be stepped at. Defaults to 1 / 60, but you can change here. Also see useElapsedTime property.

public.name: friction
public.inlineHelp: Friction between colliding bodies. This value is used if no matching ContactMaterial is found for a Material pair.

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: Local reference to game.

public.name: gravity
public.inlineHelp: The gravity applied to all bodies each step.

public.name: nothingCollisionGroup
public.inlineHelp: A default collision group.

public.name: onBeginContact
public.inlineHelp: Dispatched when a first contact is created between two bodies. This event is fired before the step has been done.

public.name: onBodyAdded
public.inlineHelp: Dispatched when a new Body is added to the World.

public.name: onBodyRemoved
public.inlineHelp: Dispatched when a Body is removed from the World.

public.name: onConstraintAdded
public.inlineHelp: Dispatched when a new Constraint is added to the World.

public.name: onConstraintRemoved
public.inlineHelp: Dispatched when a Constraint is removed from the World.

public.name: onContactMaterialAdded
public.inlineHelp: Dispatched when a new ContactMaterial is added to the World.

public.name: onContactMaterialRemoved
public.inlineHelp: Dispatched when a ContactMaterial is removed from the World.

public.name: onEndContact
public.inlineHelp: Dispatched when final contact occurs between two bodies. This event is fired before the step has been done.

public.name: onSpringAdded
public.inlineHelp: Dispatched when a new Spring is added to the World.

public.name: onSpringRemoved
public.inlineHelp: Dispatched when a Spring is removed from the World.

public.name: paused
public.inlineHelp: The paused state of the P2 World.

public.name: postBroadphaseCallback
public.inlineHelp: A postBroadphase callback.

public.name: restitution
public.inlineHelp: Default coefficient of restitution between colliding bodies. This value is used if no matching ContactMaterial is found for a Material pair.

public.name: sleepMode
public.help: How to deactivate bodies during simulation. Possible modes are: World.NO_SLEEPING, World.BODY_SLEEPING and World.ISLAND_SLEEPING.\nIf sleeping is enabled, you might need to wake up the bodies if they fall asleep when they shouldn't. If you want to enable sleeping in the world, but want to disable it for a particular body, see Body.allowSleep.

public.name: solveConstraints
public.inlineHelp: Enable/disable constraint solving in each step.

public.name: time
public.inlineHelp: The World time.

public.name: total
public.inlineHelp: The total number of bodies in the world.

public.name: useElapsedTime
public.inlineHelp: If true the frameRate value will be ignored and instead p2 will step with the value of Game.Time.physicsElapsed, which is a delta time value.

public.name: walls
public.inlineHelp: An object containing the 4 wall bodies that bound the physics world.

private.name: _toRemove
private.inlineHelp: Internal var used to hold references to bodies to remove from the world on the next step.

public.help: Converts all of the polylines objects inside a Tiled ObjectGroup into physics bodies that are added to the world.\nNote that the polylines must be created in such a way that they can withstand polygon decomposition.

public.name: convertTilemap

parameters.name: map
parameters.help: The Tilemap to get the map data from.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to map.currentLayer.

parameters.name: addToWorld
parameters.help: If true it will automatically add each body to the world, otherwise it's up to you to do so.

parameters.name: optimize
parameters.help: If true adjacent colliding tiles will be combined into a single body to save processing. However it means you cannot perform specific Tile to Body collision responses.

returns.help: An array of the Phaser.Physics.P2.Body objects that were created.

public.help:
Goes through all tiles in the given Tilemap and TilemapLayer and converts those set to collide into physics bodies.
Only call this *after* you have specified all of the tiles you wish to collide with calls like Tilemap.setCollisionBetween, etc.
Every time you call this method it will destroy any previously created bodies and remove them from the world.
Therefore understand it's a very expensive operation and not to be done in a core game update loop.

public.name: createBody

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: The x coordinate of Body.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The y coordinate of Body.

parameters.name: mass
parameters.help: The mass of the Body. A mass of 0 means a 'static' Body is created.

parameters.name: addToWorld
parameters.help: Automatically add this Body to the world? (usually false as it won't have any shapes on construction).

parameters.name: options
parameters.help: An object containing the build options:

parameters.name: options.optimalDecomp
parameters.help: Set to true if you need optimal decomposition. Warning: very slow for polygons with more than 10 vertices.

parameters.name: options.skipSimpleCheck
parameters.help: Set to true if you already know that the path is not intersecting itself.

parameters.name: options.removeCollinearPoints
parameters.help: Set to a number (angle threshold value) to remove collinear points, or false to keep all points.

parameters.name: points
parameters.help: An array of 2d vectors that form the convex or concave polygon.

returns.help: The body

public.help:
Creates a new Body and adds it to the World.

Either [[0,0], [0,1],...] or a flat array of numbers that will be interpreted as [x,y, x,y, ...],
or the arguments passed can be flat x,y values e.g. `setPolygon(options, x,y, x,y, x,y, ...)` where `x` and `y` are numbers.

public.name: createCollisionGroup

parameters.name: object
parameters.help: An optional Sprite or Group to apply the Collision Group to. If a Group is given it will be applied to all top-level children.

public.help: Creates a new Collision Group and optionally applies it to the given object.\nCollision Groups are handled using bitmasks, therefore you have a fixed limit you can create before you need to re-use older groups.

public.name: createContactMaterial

parameters.name: materialA
parameters.help: The first Material to create the ContactMaterial from. If undefined it will create a new Material object first.

parameters.name: materialB
parameters.help: The second Material to create the ContactMaterial from. If undefined it will create a new Material object first.

parameters.name: options
parameters.help: Material options object.

returns.help: The Contact Material that was created.

public.help: Creates a Contact Material from the two given Materials. You can then edit the properties of the Contact Material directly.

parameters.name: bodyA
parameters.help: First connected body.

parameters.name: bodyB
parameters.help: Second connected body.

parameters.name: distance
parameters.help: The distance to keep between the bodies.

parameters.name: localAnchorA
parameters.help: The anchor point for bodyA, defined locally in bodyA frame. Defaults to [0,0].

parameters.name: localAnchorB
parameters.help: The anchor point for bodyB, defined locally in bodyB frame. Defaults to [0,0].

parameters.name: maxForce
parameters.help: The maximum force that should be applied to constrain the bodies.

returns.help: The constraint

public.help: Creates a constraint that tries to keep the distance between two bodies constant.

public.name: createGearConstraint

parameters.name: bodyA
parameters.help: First connected body.

parameters.name: bodyB
parameters.help: Second connected body.

parameters.name: angle
parameters.help: The relative angle

parameters.name: ratio
parameters.help: The gear ratio.

returns.help: The constraint

public.help: Creates a constraint that tries to keep the distance between two bodies constant.

public.name: createLockConstraint

parameters.name: bodyA
parameters.help: First connected body.

parameters.name: bodyB
parameters.help: Second connected body.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.help: The offset of bodyB in bodyA's frame. The value is an array with 2 elements matching x and y, i.e: [32, 32].

parameters.name: angle
parameters.help: The angle of bodyB in bodyA's frame.

parameters.name: maxForce
parameters.help: The maximum force that should be applied to constrain the bodies.

returns.help: The constraint

public.help: Locks the relative position between two bodies.

public.name: createMaterial

parameters.name: name
parameters.help: Optional name of the Material. Each Material has a unique ID but string names are handy for debugging.

parameters.name: body
parameters.help: Optional Body. If given it will assign the newly created Material to the Body shapes.

returns.help: The Material that was created. This is also stored in Phaser.Physics.P2.materials.

public.help: Creates a Material. Materials are applied to Shapes owned by a Body and can be set with Body.setMaterial().\nMaterials are a way to control what happens when Shapes collide. Combine unique Materials together to create Contact Materials.\nContact Materials have properties such as friction and restitution that allow for fine-grained collision control between different Materials.

public.name: createParticle

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: The x coordinate of Body.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The y coordinate of Body.

parameters.name: mass
parameters.help: The mass of the Body. A mass of 0 means a 'static' Body is created.

parameters.name: addToWorld
parameters.help: Automatically add this Body to the world? (usually false as it won't have any shapes on construction).

parameters.name: options
parameters.help: An object containing the build options:

parameters.name: options.optimalDecomp
parameters.help: Set to true if you need optimal decomposition. Warning: very slow for polygons with more than 10 vertices.

parameters.name: options.skipSimpleCheck
parameters.help: Set to true if you already know that the path is not intersecting itself.

parameters.name: options.removeCollinearPoints
parameters.help: Set to a number (angle threshold value) to remove collinear points, or false to keep all points.

parameters.name: points
parameters.help: An array of 2d vectors that form the convex or concave polygon.

public.help:
Creates a new Particle and adds it to the World.

Either [[0,0], [0,1],...] or a flat array of numbers that will be interpreted as [x,y, x,y, ...],
or the arguments passed can be flat x,y values e.g. `setPolygon(options, x,y, x,y, x,y, ...)` where `x` and `y` are numbers.

public.name: createPrismaticConstraint

parameters.name: bodyA
parameters.help: First connected body.

parameters.name: bodyB
parameters.help: Second connected body.

parameters.name: lockRotation
parameters.help: If set to false, bodyB will be free to rotate around its anchor point.

parameters.name: anchorA
parameters.help: Body A's anchor point, defined in its own local frame. The value is an array with 2 elements matching x and y, i.e: [32, 32].

parameters.name: anchorB
parameters.help: Body A's anchor point, defined in its own local frame. The value is an array with 2 elements matching x and y, i.e: [32, 32].

parameters.name: axis
parameters.help: An axis, defined in body A frame, that body B's anchor point may slide along. The value is an array with 2 elements matching x and y, i.e: [32, 32].

parameters.name: maxForce
parameters.help: The maximum force that should be applied to constrain the bodies.

returns.help: The constraint

public.help: Constraint that only allows bodies to move along a line, relative to each other.\nSee http://www.iforce2d.net/b2dtut/joints-prismatic

public.name: createRevoluteConstraint

parameters.name: bodyA
parameters.help: First connected body.

parameters.name: pivotA
parameters.help: The point relative to the center of mass of bodyA which bodyA is constrained to. The value is an array with 2 elements matching x and y, i.e: [32, 32].

parameters.name: bodyB
parameters.help: Second connected body.

parameters.name: pivotB
parameters.help: The point relative to the center of mass of bodyB which bodyB is constrained to. The value is an array with 2 elements matching x and y, i.e: [32, 32].

parameters.name: maxForce
parameters.help: The maximum force that should be applied to constrain the bodies.

parameters.name: worldPivot
parameters.help: A pivot point given in world coordinates. If specified, localPivotA and localPivotB are automatically computed from this value.

returns.help: The constraint

public.help: Connects two bodies at given offset points, letting them rotate relative to each other around this point.\nThe pivot points are given in world (pixel) coordinates.

parameters.name: bodyB

parameters.name: stiffness

parameters.name: damping
parameters.help: Damping of the spring. A number >= 0.

parameters.name: bodyA

parameters.help: Second connected body.

parameters.name: damping
parameters.help: Damping of the spring. A number >= 0.

parameters.name: worldA

parameters.name: worldB

parameters.name: localA
parameters.help: Where to hook the spring to body A in local body coordinates. This value is an array by 2 elements, x and y, i.e: [32, 32].

parameters.name: localB

returns.help: The spring

public.name: destroy
public.help: Clears all bodies from the simulation and unlinks World from Game. Should only be called on game shutdown. Call `clear` on a State change.

public.name: enable

parameters.name: object
parameters.help: The game object to create the physics body on. Can also be an array or Group of objects, a body will be created on every child that has a `body` property.

parameters.name: debug
parameters.help: Create a debug object to go with this body?

parameters.name: children
parameters.help: Should a body be created on all children of this object? If true it will recurse down the display list as far as it can go.

public.help: This will create a P2 Physics body on the given game object or array of game objects.\nA game object can only have 1 physics body active at any one time, and it can't be changed until the object is destroyed.\nNote: When the game object is enabled for P2 physics it has its anchor x/y set to 0.5 so it becomes centered.

public.name: enableBody

parameters.name: object

parameters.name: debug

public.help: Creates a P2 Physics body on the given game object.\nA game object can only have 1 physics body active at any one time, and it can't be changed until the body is nulled.

parameters.help: A list of objects to check for intersection. If not given it will check Phaser.Physics.P2.world.bodies (i.e. all world bodies)

public.name: setCollisionGroup

parameters.name: object
parameters.help: A Sprite or Group to apply the Collision Group to. If a Group is given it will be applied to all top-level children.

parameters.name: group
parameters.help: The Collision Group that this Bodies shapes will use.

public.help: Sets the given CollisionGroup to be the collision group for all shapes in this Body, unless a shape is specified.\nNote that this resets the collisionMask and any previously set groups. See Body.collides() for appending them.

public.name: setImpactEvents

parameters.name: state
parameters.help: Set to true to enable impact events, or false to disable.

public.help: Impact event handling is disabled by default. Enable it before any impact events will be dispatched.\nIn a busy world hundreds of impact events can be generated every step, so only enable this if you cannot do what you need via beginContact or collision masks.

public.name: setMaterial

parameters.name: material
parameters.help: The Material to be applied to the given Bodies.

parameters.name: bodies
parameters.help: An Array of Body objects that the given Material will be set on.

public.help: Sets the given Material against all Shapes owned by all the Bodies in the given array.

public.name: setPostBroadphaseCallback

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The callback that will receive the postBroadphase event data. It must return a boolean. Set to null to disable an existing callback.

parameters.name: context
parameters.help: The context under which the callback will be fired.

public.help:
Sets a callback to be fired after the Broadphase has collected collision pairs in the world.
Just because a pair exists it doesn't mean they *will* collide, just that they potentially could do.
If your calback returns `false` the pair will be removed from the narrowphase. This will stop them testing for collision this step.
Returning `true` from the callback will ensure they are checked in the narrowphase.

public.name: setWorldMaterial

parameters.name: material
parameters.help: The material to set.

parameters.name: left
parameters.help: If true will set the material on the left bounds wall.

parameters.name: right
parameters.help: If true will set the material on the right bounds wall.

parameters.name: top
parameters.help: If true will set the material on the top bounds wall.

parameters.name: bottom
parameters.help: If true will set the material on the bottom bounds wall.

public.help: Sets the given material against the 4 bounds of this World.

public.help: Converts the current world into a JSON object.

public.help: Internal P2 update loop.

public.name: updateBoundsCollisionGroup

parameters.name: setCollisionGroup
parameters.help: If true the Bounds will be set to use its own Collision Group.

public.help: By default the World will be set to collide everything with everything. The bounds of the world is a Body with 4 shapes, one for each face.\nIf you start to use your own collision groups then your objects will no longer collide with the bounds.\nTo fix this you need to adjust the bounds to use its own collision group first BEFORE changing your Sprites collision group.

public.name: buttonCode
public.inlineHelp: The buttoncode of this button.

public.name: duration
public.inlineHelp: The number of milliseconds this button has been held down for.
public.help: If the button is down this value holds the duration of that button press and is constantly updated.\nIf the button is up it holds the duration of the previous down session.

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the currently running game.

public.name: isDown
public.inlineHelp: The "down" state of the button.

public.name: isUp
public.inlineHelp: The "up" state of the button.

public.name: onDown
public.inlineHelp: This Signal is dispatched every time this GamepadButton is pressed down. It is only dispatched once (until the button is released again).

public.name: onFloat
public.inlineHelp: This Signal is dispatched every time this GamepadButton changes floating value (between (but not exactly) 0 and 1)

public.name: onUp
public.inlineHelp: This Signal is dispatched every time this GamepadButton is pressed down. It is only dispatched once (until the button is released again).

public.name: pad
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the gamepad that owns this button.

public.name: repeats
public.inlineHelp: If a button is held down this holds down the number of times the button has 'repeated'.

public.name: timeDown
public.inlineHelp: The timestamp when the button was last pressed down.

public.name: timeUp
public.inlineHelp: The timestamp when the button was last released.

public.name: value
public.inlineHelp: Button value. Mainly useful for checking analog buttons (like shoulder triggers)
