public.inlineHelp: Reserved for future multiple camera set-ups.

public.name: position
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the cameras xy position using Phaser.Point object.
public.help: The Cameras position. This value is automatically clamped if it falls outside of the World bounds.

public.name: roundPx
public.inlineHelp: If a Camera has roundPx set to `true` it will call `view.floor` as part of its update loop, keeping its boundary to integer values. Set this to `false` to disable this from happening.

public.name: scale
public.inlineHelp: The scale of the display object to which all game objects are added. Set by World.boot

public.name: screenView
public.inlineHelp: Used by Sprites to work out Camera culling.

public.name: target
public.inlineHelp: If the camera is tracking a Sprite, this is a reference to it, otherwise null.

public.name: view
public.help:
Camera view.
The view into the world we wish to render (by default the game dimensions).
The x/y values are in world coordinates, not screen coordinates, the width/height is how many pixels to render.
Objects outside of this view are not rendered if set to camera cull.

public.name: visible
public.inlineHelp: Whether this camera is visible or not.

public.name: width

returns.help: true if the given domain fragment can be found in the window.location.hostname

public.help:
Compares the given domain name against the hostname of the browser containing the game.
If the domain name is found it returns true.
You can specify a part of a domain, for example 'google' would match 'google.com', 'google.co.uk', etc.
Do not include 'http://' at the start.

returns.help: The decoded value.

public.help: Returns the Query String as an object.\nIf you specify a parameter it will return just the value of that parameter, should it exist.

public.help: Returns the hostname given by the browser.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.help: If specified this will return just the value for that key.

returns.help: An object containing the key value pairs found in the query string or just the value if a parameter was given.

public.name: updateQueryString

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The querystring key to update.

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The new value to be set. If it already exists it will be replaced.

parameters.name: redirect
parameters.help: If true the browser will issue a redirect to the url with the new querystring.

parameters.name: url
parameters.help: The URL to modify. If none is given it uses window.location.href.

returns.help: If redirect is false then the modified url and query string is returned.

public.help:
Updates a value on the Query String and returns it in full.
If the value doesn't already exist it is set.
If the value exists it is replaced with the new value given. If you don't provide a new value it is removed from the query string.
Optionally you can redirect to the new url, or just return it as a string.

class.help:
The Matrix class is now an object, which makes it a lot faster,
here is a representation of it :
| a | b | tx|
| c | d | ty|
| 0 | 0 | 1 |

Creates a Matrix object based on the given array. The Element to Matrix mapping order is as follows:

a = array[0]
b = array[1]
c = array[3]
d = array[4]
tx = array[2]
ty = array[5]

class.help:
The Events component is a collection of events fired by the parent game object.

For example to tell when a Sprite has been added to a new group:

`sprite.events.onAddedToGroup.add(yourFunction, this);`

Where `yourFunction` is the function you want called when this event occurs.

Note that the Input related events only exist if the Sprite has had `inputEnabled` set to `true`.

parameters.name: sprite
parameters.help: A reference to the Sprite that owns this Events object.

public.name: alive
public.inlineHelp: The alive property is useful for Groups that are children of other Groups and need to be included/excluded in checks like forEachAlive.

public.name: alpha
public.help: The opacity of the object.

public.name: angle
public.inlineHelp: The angle of rotation given in degrees, where 0 degrees = to the right.
public.help: The angle of rotation of the Group container. This will adjust the Group container itself by modifying its rotation.\nThis will have no impact on the rotation value of its children, but it will update their worldTransform and on-screen position.

public.name: bounds
public.inlineHelp: Bound of this world that objects can not escape from.
public.help:
The World has no fixed size, but it does have a bounds outside of which objects are no longer considered as being "in world" and you should use this to clean-up the display list and purge dead objects.
By default we set the Bounds to be from 0,0 to Game.width,Game.height. I.e. it will match the size given to the game constructor with 0,0 representing the top-left of the display.
However 0,0 is actually the center of the world, and if you rotate or scale the world all of that will happen from 0,0.
So if you want to make a game in which the world itself will rotate you should adjust the bounds so that 0,0 is the center point, i.e. set them to -1000,-1000,2000,2000 for a 2000x2000 sized world centered around 0,0.

public.help: Set if this display object is cached as a bitmap.\nThis basically takes a snap shot of the display object as it is at that moment. It can provide a performance benefit for complex static displayObjects.\nTo remove simply set this property to 'null'

public.help: The cursor is a simple way to iterate through the objects in a Group using the Group.next and Group.previous functions.\nThe cursor is set to the first child added to the Group and doesn't change unless you call next, previous or set it directly with Group.cursor.

public.help: This is the cursor that will be used when the mouse is over this object. To enable this the element must have interaction = true and buttonMode = true\n

public.inlineHelp: If true all Sprites created by, or added to this Group, will have a physics body enabled on them. Change the body type with `Group.physicsBodyType`.

public.name: enableBodyDebug
public.inlineHelp: If true when a physics body is created (via Group.enableBody) it will create a physics debug object as well. Only works for P2 bodies.

public.name: filters
public.help: Sets the filters for the displayObject.\n* IMPORTANT: This is a webGL only feature and will be ignored by the canvas renderer.\nTo remove filters simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: fixedToCamera
public.inlineHelp: Set to true to fix this Group to the Camera at its current world coordinates.
public.help: A Group that is fixed to the camera uses its x/y coordinates as offsets from the top left of the camera. These are stored in Group.cameraOffset.\nNote that the cameraOffset values are in addition to any parent in the display list.\nSo if this Group was in a Group that has x: 200, then this will be added to the cameraOffset.x

A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it.\nIn PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping.\nTo remove a mask, set this property to null.

class.help:
"This world is but a canvas to our imagination." - Henry David Thoreau

A game has only one world. The world is an abstract place in which all game objects live. It is not bound
by stage limits and can be any size. You look into the world via cameras. All game objects live within
the world at world-based coordinates. By default a world is created the same size as your Stage.

The object can be an instance of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Button or any other display object.\nThe child is automatically added to the top of the Group, so renders on-top of everything else within the Group. If you need to control\nthat then see the addAt method.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

public.help: Adds the amount to the given property on all children in this Group.\nGroup.addAll('x', 10) will add 10 to the child.x value.

parameters.help: The function that exists on the children that will be called.

parameters.name: existsValue
parameters.help: Only children with exists=existsValue will be called.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.help: Additional parameters that will be passed to the callback.

public.help: Calls a function on all of the children that have exists=true in this Group.\nAfter the existsValue parameter you can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the child callback.

public.name: checkAll

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be checked.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If set then only children with alive=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If set then only children with visible=true will be checked. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.

public.help: This function allows you to quickly check that the same property across all children of this Group is equal to the given value.\nThis call doesn't descend down children, so if you have a Group inside of this Group, the property will be checked on the Group but not its children.

public.name: checkProperty

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to check the property value on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: An array of strings that make up the property that will be set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be checked.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be checked on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If true and the property doesn't exist, false will be returned.

returns.help: True if the property was was equal to value, false if not.

public.help: Checks a property for the given value on the child.

public.name: click
public.help: A callback that is used when the users clicks on the displayObject with their mouse's left button

public.name: countDead

returns.help: The number of children flagged as dead.

public.help: Call this function to find out how many members of the group are dead.

public.name: countLiving

returns.help: The number of children flagged as alive.

public.help: Call this function to find out how many members of the group are alive.

public.name: create

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: The x coordinate to display the newly created Sprite at. The value is in relation to the Group.x point.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The y coordinate to display the newly created Sprite at. The value is in relation to the Group.y point.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.help: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.

parameters.name: exists
parameters.help: The default exists state of the Sprite.

returns.help: The child that was created. Will be a Phaser.Sprite unless Group.classType has been changed.

public.help: Automatically creates a new Phaser.Sprite object and adds it to the top of this Group.\nYou can change Group.classType to any object and this call will create an object of that type instead, but it should extend either Sprite or Image.

public.name: createMultiple

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.help: The number of Sprites to create.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.help: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.

parameters.name: exists
parameters.help: The default exists state of the Sprite.

public.help:
Automatically creates multiple Phaser.Sprite objects and adds them to the top of this Group.
Useful if you need to quickly generate a pool of identical sprites, such as bullets. By default the sprites will be set to not exist
and will be positioned at 0, 0 (relative to the Group.x/y)
You can change Group.classType to any object and this call will create an object of that type instead, but it should extend either Sprite or Image.

public.name: customSort

parameters.name: sortHandler
parameters.help: Your sort handler function. It will be sent two parameters: the two children involved in the comparison. It must return -1, 1 or 0.

parameters.name: context
parameters.help: The scope in which the sortHandler is called.

public.help: This allows you to use your own sort handler function.\nIt will be sent two parameters: the two children involved in the comparison (a and b). It should return -1 if a > b, 1 if a < b or 0 if a === b.

public.name: descendingSortHandler

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The first object being sorted.

parameters.name: b
parameters.help: The second object being sorted.

public.help: An internal helper function for the sort process.

public.name: destroy

parameters.name: destroyChildren
parameters.help: Should every child of this Group have its destroy method called?

parameters.name: soft
parameters.help: A 'soft destroy' (set to true) doesn't remove this Group from its parent or null the game reference. Set to false and it does.

public.help: Destroys this Group. Removes all children, then removes the container from the display list and nulls references.

public.name: divideAll

parameters.name: property
parameters.help: The property to divide, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.help: The amount to divide the property by. If child.x = 100 then divideAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 50.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

public.help: Divides the given property by the amount on all children in this Group.\nGroup.divideAll('x', 2) will half the child.x value.

public.name: filter

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.help: The function that each child will be evaluated against. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter, the index as the second, and the entire child array as the third

parameters.name: checkExists
parameters.help: If set only children with exists=true will be passed to the callback, otherwise all children will be passed.

returns.help: Returns an array list containing all the children that the predicate returned true for

public.name: forEach

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that will be called. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

parameters.name: checkExists
parameters.help: If set only children with exists=true will be passed to the callback, otherwise all children will be passed.

public.help:
Allows you to call your own function on each member of this Group. You must pass the callback and context in which it will run.
After the checkExists parameter you can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child.
For example: Group.forEach(awardBonusGold, this, true, 100, 500)
Note: Currently this will skip any children which are Groups themselves.

public.name: forEachAlive

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that will be called. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

public.help: Allows you to call your own function on each alive member of this Group (where child.alive=true). You must pass the callback and context in which it will run.\nYou can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child.\nFor example: Group.forEachAlive(causeDamage, this, 500)

public.name: forEachDead

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that will be called. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

public.help: Allows you to call your own function on each dead member of this Group (where alive=false). You must pass the callback and context in which it will run.\nYou can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child.\nFor example: Group.forEachDead(bringToLife, this)

public.name: forEachExists

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The function that will be called. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

public.help: Allows you to call your own function on each member of this Group where child.exists=true. You must pass the callback and context in which it will run.\nYou can add as many parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child.\nFor example: Group.forEachExists(causeDamage, this, 500)

public.name: generateTexture

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.help: The resolution of the texture being generated

parameters.name: scaleMode
parameters.help: Should be one of the PIXI.scaleMode consts

parameters.name: renderer
parameters.help: The renderer used to generate the texture.

returns.help: a texture of the graphics object

public.help: Useful function that returns a texture of the displayObject object that can then be used to create sprites\nThis can be quite useful if your displayObject is static / complicated and needs to be reused multiple times.

public.name: getAt

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index to return the child from.

returns.help: The child that was found at the given index. If the index was out of bounds then this will return -1.

public.help: Returns the child found at the given index within this Group.

public.name: getBottom

returns.help: The child at the bottom of the Group.

public.help: Returns the child at the bottom of this Group. The bottom is the one being displayed (rendered) below every other child.

public.name: getBounds

returns.help: The rectangular bounding area

public.help: Retrieves the bounds of the displayObjectContainer as a rectangle. The bounds calculation takes all visible children into consideration.

public.name: getChildAt

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index to get the child from

returns.help: The child at the given index, if any.

public.help: Returns the child at the specified index

public.name: getChildIndex

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The DisplayObject instance to identify

returns.help: The index position of the child display object to identify

public.help: Returns the index position of a child DisplayObject instance

public.name: getFirstAlive

returns.help: The first alive child, or null if none found.

public.help: Call this function to retrieve the first object with alive === true in the group.\nThis is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

public.name: getFirstDead

returns.help: The first dead child, or null if none found.

public.help: Call this function to retrieve the first object with alive === false in the group.\nThis is handy for checking if everything has been wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

public.name: getFirstExists

parameters.name: state
parameters.help: True or false.

returns.help: The first child, or null if none found.

public.help: Call this function to retrieve the first object with exists == (the given state) in the Group.

public.name: getIndex

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to get the index for.

returns.help: The index of the child or -1 if it's not a member of this Group.

public.help: Get the index position of the given child in this Group. This should always match the childs z property.

public.name: getLocalBounds

returns.help: The rectangular bounding area

public.help: Retrieves the non-global local bounds of the displayObjectContainer as a rectangle. The calculation takes all visible children into consideration.

public.name: getRandom

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.help: Optional offset off the front of the array. Default value is 0, or the beginning of the array.

parameters.name: length
parameters.help: Optional restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.

returns.help: A random child of this Group.

public.help: Returns a member at random from the group.

public.name: getTop

returns.help: The child at the top of the Group.

public.help: Returns the child at the top of this Group. The top is the one being displayed (rendered) above every other child.

public.name: hasProperty

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to check for the existance of the property on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: An array of strings that make up the property.

returns.help: True if the child has the property, otherwise false.

public.help: Checks if the child has the given property. Will scan up to 4 levels deep only.

public.name: iterate

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The child property to check, i.e. 'exists', 'alive', 'health'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: If child.key === this value it will be considered a match. Note that a strict comparison is used.

parameters.name: returnType
parameters.help: How to return the data from this method. Either Phaser.Group.RETURN_NONE, Phaser.Group.RETURN_TOTAL or Phaser.Group.RETURN_CHILD.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: Optional function that will be called on each matching child. Each child of the Group will be passed to it as its first parameter.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which the function should be called (usually 'this').

returns.help: Returns either a numeric total (if RETURN_TOTAL was specified) or the child object.

public.help: Iterates over the children of the Group. When a child has a property matching key that equals the given value, it is considered as a match.\nMatched children can be sent to the optional callback, or simply returned or counted.\nYou can add as many callback parameters as you like, which will all be passed to the callback along with the child, after the callbackContext parameter.

public.name: mousedown
public.help: A callback that is used when the user clicks the mouse's left button down over the sprite

public.name: mouseout
public.help: A callback that is used when the users mouse leaves the displayObject

public.name: mouseover
public.help: A callback that is used when the users mouse rolls over the displayObject

public.name: mouseup
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's left button that was over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired, the mouse's left button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

public.name: mouseupoutside
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's left button that was over the displayObject but is no longer over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired, the mouse's left button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

public.name: moveDown

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to move down in the Group.

returns.help: The child that was moved.

public.help: Moves the given child down one place in this Group unless it's already at the top.

public.name: moveUp

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to move up in the Group.

returns.help: The child that was moved.

public.help: Moves the given child up one place in this Group unless it's already at the top.

public.name: multiplyAll

parameters.name: property
parameters.help: The property to multiply, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.help: The amount to multiply the property by. If child.x = 10 then multiplyAll('x', 2) would make child.x = 20.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

public.help: Multiplies the given property by the amount on all children in this Group.\nGroup.multiplyAll('x', 2) will x2 the child.x value.

public.name: next

returns.help: The child the cursor now points to.

public.help: Advances the Group cursor to the next object in the Group. If it's at the end of the Group it wraps around to the first object.

public.name: previous

returns.help: The child the cursor now points to.

public.help: Moves the Group cursor to the previous object in the Group. If it's at the start of the Group it wraps around to the last object.

public.name: remove

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to remove.

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.help: You can optionally call destroy on the child that was removed.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the child will not dispatch the onRemovedFromGroup event.

returns.help: true if the child was removed from this Group, otherwise false.

public.help: Removes the given child from this Group. This will dispatch an onRemovedFromGroup event from the child (if it has one),\nreset the Group cursor and optionally destroy the child.

public.name: removeAll

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.help: You can optionally call destroy on each child that is removed.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the children will not dispatch their onRemovedFromGroup events.

public.help: Removes all children from this Group, setting the group properties of the children to `null`.\nThe Group container remains on the display list.

public.name: removeBetween

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.help: The index to start removing children from.

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.help: The index to stop removing children at. Must be higher than startIndex. If undefined this method will remove all children between startIndex and the end of the Group.

parameters.name: destroy
parameters.help: You can optionally call destroy on the child that was removed.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.help: If the silent parameter is `true` the children will not dispatch their onRemovedFromGroup events.

public.help: Removes all children from this Group whos index falls beteen the given startIndex and endIndex values.

public.name: removeChild

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The DisplayObject to remove

returns.help: The child that was removed.

public.help: Removes a child from the container.

public.name: removeChildAt

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index to get the child from

returns.help: The child that was removed.

public.help: Removes a child from the specified index position.

public.name: removeChildren

parameters.name: beginIndex
parameters.help: The beginning position. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.help: The ending position. Default value is size of the container.

public.help: Removes all children from this container that are within the begin and end indexes.

public.name: removeStageReference
public.help: Removes the current stage reference from the container and all of its children.

public.name: replace

parameters.name: oldChild
parameters.help: The child in this Group that will be replaced.

parameters.name: newChild
parameters.help: The child to be inserted into this Group.

returns.help: Returns the oldChild that was replaced within this Group.

public.help: Replaces a child of this Group with the given newChild. The newChild cannot be a member of this Group.

public.name: resetCursor

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: Set the cursor to point to a specific index.

returns.help: The child the cursor now points to.

public.help: Sets the Group cursor to the first object in the Group. If the optional index parameter is given it sets the cursor to the object at that index instead.

public.name: reverse
public.help: Reverses all children in this Group. Note that this does not propagate, only direct children are re-ordered.

public.name: rightclick
public.help: A callback that is used when the users clicks on the displayObject with their mouse's right button

public.name: rightdown
public.help: A callback that is used when the user clicks the mouse's right button down over the sprite

public.name: rightup
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's right button that was over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired the mouse's right button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

public.name: rightupoutside
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse's right button that was over the displayObject but is no longer over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired, the mouse's right button must have been pressed down over the displayObject

public.name: sendToBack

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to send to the bottom of this Group.

returns.help: The child that was moved.

public.help: Sends the given child to the bottom of this Group so it renders below all other children.

public.name: set

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to set the property on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If set then the child will only be updated if alive=true.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If set then the child will only be updated if visible=true.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.help: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

returns.help: True if the property was set, false if not.

public.help: This function allows you to quickly set a property on a single child of this Group to a new value.\nThe operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

public.name: setAll

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If set then only children with alive=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If set then only children with visible=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.help: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

public.help:
This function allows you to quickly set the same property across all children of this Group to a new value.
This call doesn't descend down children, so if you have a Group inside of this Group, the property will be set on the Group but not its children.
If you need that ability please see `Group.setAllChildren`.

The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

public.name: setAllChildren

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The property, as a string, to be set. For example: 'body.velocity.x'

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If set then only children with alive=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If set then only children with visible=true will be updated. This includes any Groups that are children.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.help: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

public.help:
This function allows you to quickly set the same property across all children of this Group, and any child Groups, to a new value.

If this Group contains other Groups then the same property is set across their children as well, iterating down until it reaches the bottom.
Unlike with Group.setAll the property is NOT set on child Groups itself.

The operation parameter controls how the new value is assigned to the property, from simple replacement to addition and multiplication.

public.name: setBounds

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: Top left most corner of the world.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: Top left most corner of the world.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: New width of the game world in pixels.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: New height of the game world in pixels.

public.help: Updates the size of this world. Note that this doesn't modify the world x/y coordinates, just the width and height.\nThe Camera bounds and Physics bounds (if set) are also updated to match the new World bounds.

public.name: setChildIndex

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child DisplayObject instance for which you want to change the index number

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The resulting index number for the child display object

public.help: Changes the position of an existing child in the display object container

public.name: setProperty

parameters.name: child
parameters.help: The child to set the property value on.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: An array of strings that make up the property that will be set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.help: The value that will be set.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.help: Controls how the value is assigned. A value of 0 replaces the value with the new one. A value of 1 adds it, 2 subtracts it, 3 multiplies it and 4 divides it.

parameters.name: force
parameters.help: If `force` is true then the property will be set on the child regardless if it already exists or not. If false and the property doesn't exist, nothing will be set.

returns.help: True if the property was set, false if not.

public.help:
Sets a property to the given value on the child. The operation parameter controls how the value is set.
Operation 0 means set the existing value to the given value, or if force is `false` create a new property with the given value.
1 will add the given value to the value already present.
2 will subtract the given value from the value already present.
3 will multiply the value already present by the given value.
4 will divide the value already present by the given value.

public.name: setStageReference

parameters.name: stage
parameters.help: the stage that the container will have as its current stage reference

public.help: Sets the containers Stage reference. This is the Stage that this object, and all of its children, is connected to.

public.name: shutdown
public.help: Destroyer of worlds.

public.name: sort

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The `string` name of the property you want to sort on. Defaults to the objects z-depth value.

parameters.name: order
parameters.help: The `Group` constant that defines the sort order. Possible values are Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING and Phaser.Group.SORT_DESCENDING.

public.help: Call this function to sort the group according to a particular value and order.\nFor example to depth sort Sprites for Zelda-style game you might call `group.sort('y', Phaser.Group.SORT_ASCENDING)` at the bottom of your `State.update()`.

public.name: subAll

parameters.name: property
parameters.help: The property to decrement, for example 'body.velocity.x' or 'angle'.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.help: The amount to subtract from the property. If child.x = 50 then subAll('x', 40) would make child.x = 10.

parameters.name: checkAlive
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is alive.

parameters.name: checkVisible
parameters.help: If true the property will only be changed if the child is visible.

public.help: Subtracts the amount from the given property on all children in this Group.\nGroup.subAll('x', 10) will minus 10 from the child.x value.

public.name: swap

parameters.name: child1
parameters.help: The first child to swap.

parameters.name: child2
parameters.help: The second child to swap.

public.help: Swaps the position of two children in this Group. Both children must be in this Group.\nYou cannot swap a child with itself, or swap un-parented children.

public.name: swapChildren
public.help: Swaps the position of 2 Display Objects within this container.

public.name: tap
public.help: A callback that is used when the users taps on the sprite with their finger\nbasically a touch version of click

public.name: toGlobal

parameters.name: position
parameters.help: The world origin to calculate from

returns.help: A point object representing the position of this object

public.help: Calculates the global position of the display object

public.name: toLocal

parameters.name: position
parameters.help: The world origin to calculate from

parameters.name: [from]
parameters.help: The DisplayObject to calculate the global position from

returns.help: A point object representing the position of this object

public.help: Calculates the local position of the display object relative to another point

public.name: touchend
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases a touch over the displayObject

public.name: touchendoutside
public.help: A callback that is used when the user releases the touch that was over the displayObject\nfor this callback to be fired, The touch must have started over the sprite

public.name: touchstart
public.help: A callback that is used when the user touches over the displayObject

public.name: updateCache
public.help: Generates and updates the cached sprite for this object.

public.name: wrap

parameters.name: sprite
parameters.help: The object you wish to wrap around the world bounds.

parameters.name: padding
parameters.help: Extra padding added equally to the sprite.x and y coordinates before checking if within the world bounds. Ignored if useBounds is true.

parameters.name: useBounds
parameters.help: If useBounds is false wrap checks the object.x/y coordinates. If true it does a more accurate bounds check, which is more expensive.

parameters.name: horizontal
parameters.help: If horizontal is false, wrap will not wrap the object.x coordinates horizontally.

parameters.name: vertical
parameters.help: If vertical is false, wrap will not wrap the object.y coordinates vertically.

public.help: This will take the given game object and check if its x/y coordinates fall outside of the world bounds.\nIf they do it will reposition the object to the opposite side of the world, creating a wrap-around effect.\nIf sprite has a P2 body then the body (sprite.body) should be passed as first parameter to the function.

public.name: xy

parameters.name: index

class.help: A Timer is a way to create small re-usable or disposable objects that do nothing but wait for a specific moment in time, and then dispatch an event.\nYou can add as many events to a Timer as you like, each with their own delays. A Timer uses milliseconds as its unit of time. There are 1000 ms in 1 second.\nSo if you want to fire an event every quarter of a second you'd need to set the delay to 250.

parameters.name: game
parameters.help: A reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: autoDestroy
parameters.help: A Timer that is set to automatically destroy itself will do so after all of its events have been dispatched (assuming no looping events).

public.help: Adds a new Event to this Timer. The event will fire after the given amount of 'delay' in milliseconds has passed, once the Timer has started running.\nCall Timer.start() once you have added all of the Events you require for this Timer. The delay is in relation to when the Timer starts, not the time it was added.\nIf the Timer is already running the delay will be calculated based on the timers current time.

public.help:
Adds a new looped Event to this Timer that will repeat forever or until the Timer is stopped.
The event will fire after the given amount of 'delay' milliseconds has passed once the Timer has started running.
Call Timer.start() once you have added all of the Events you require for this Timer. The delay is in relation to when the Timer starts, not the time it was added.
If the Timer is already running the delay will be calculated based on the timers current time.

public.name: order
public.help: Orders the events on this Timer so they are in tick order. This is called automatically when new events are created.

public.help:
Adds a new TimerEvent that will always play through once and then repeat for the given number of iterations.
The event will fire after the given amount of 'delay' milliseconds has passed once the Timer has started running.
Call Timer.start() once you have added all of the Events you require for this Timer. The delay is in relation to when the Timer starts, not the time it was added.
If the Timer is already running the delay will be calculated based on the timers current time.

class.help:
Creates a new Phaser.Tilemap object. The map can either be populated with data from a Tiled JSON file or from a CSV file.
To do this pass the Cache key as the first parameter. When using Tiled data you need only provide the key.
When using CSV data you must provide the key and the tileWidth and tileHeight parameters.
If creating a blank tilemap to be populated later, you can either specify no parameters at all and then use `Tilemap.create` or pass the map and tile dimensions here.
Note that all Tilemaps use a base tile size to calculate dimensions from, but that a TilemapLayer may have its own unique tile size that overrides it.
A Tile map is rendered to the display using a TilemapLayer. It is not added to the display list directly itself.
A map may have multiple layers. You can perform operations on the map data such as copying, pasting, filling and shuffling the tiles around.

parameters.name: game
parameters.help: Game reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The key of the tilemap data as stored in the Cache. If you're creating a blank map either leave this parameter out or pass `null`.

parameters.name: tileWidth
parameters.help: The pixel width of a single map tile. If using CSV data you must specify this. Not required if using Tiled map data.

parameters.name: tileHeight
parameters.help: The pixel height of a single map tile. If using CSV data you must specify this. Not required if using Tiled map data.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width of the map in tiles. If this map is created from Tiled or CSV data you don't need to specify this.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height of the map in tiles. If this map is created from Tiled or CSV data you don't need to specify this.

public.name: createFromObjects

parameters.name: name
parameters.help: The name of the Object Group to create Sprites from.

parameters.name: gid
parameters.help: The layer array index value, or if a string is given the layer name within the map data.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.help: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.

parameters.name: exists
parameters.help: The default exists state of the Sprite.

parameters.name: autoCull
parameters.help: The default autoCull state of the Sprite. Sprites that are autoCulled are culled from the camera if out of its range.

parameters.name: group
parameters.help: Group to add the Sprite to. If not specified it will be added to the World group.

parameters.name: CustomClass
parameters.help: If you wish to create your own class, rather than Phaser.Sprite, pass the class here. Your class must extend Phaser.Sprite and have the same constructor parameters.

parameters.name: adjustY
parameters.help: By default the Tiled map editor uses a bottom-left coordinate system. Phaser uses top-left. So most objects will appear too low down. This parameter moves them up by their height.

public.help:
Creates a Sprite for every object matching the given gid in the map data. You can optionally specify the group that the Sprite will be created in. If none is
given it will be created in the World. All properties from the map data objectgroup are copied across to the Sprite, so you can use this as an easy way to
configure Sprite properties from within the map editor. For example giving an object a property of alpha: 0.5 in the map editor will duplicate that when the
Sprite is created. You could also give it a value like: body.velocity.x: 100 to set it moving automatically.

public.name: createLayer

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer array index value, or if a string is given the layer name, within the map data that this TilemapLayer represents.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The rendered width of the layer, should never be wider than Game.width. If not given it will be set to Game.width.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The rendered height of the layer, should never be wider than Game.height. If not given it will be set to Game.height.

parameters.name: group
parameters.help: Optional Group to add the object to. If not specified it will be added to the World group.

returns.help: The TilemapLayer object. This is an extension of Phaser.Sprite and can be moved around the display list accordingly.

public.help:
Creates a new TilemapLayer object. By default TilemapLayers are fixed to the camera.
The `layer` parameter is important. If you've created your map in Tiled then you can get this by looking in Tiled and looking at the Layer name.
Or you can open the JSON file it exports and look at the layers[].name value. Either way it must match.
If you wish to create a blank layer to put your own tiles on then see Tilemap.createBlankLayer.

public.name: destroy
public.help: Removes all layer data from this tile map and nulls the game reference.\nNote: You are responsible for destroying any TilemapLayer objects you generated yourself, as Tilemap doesn't keep a reference to them.

public.name: searchTileIndex

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The tile index value to search for.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.help: The number of times to skip a matching tile before returning.

parameters.name: reverse
parameters.help: If true it will scan the layer in reverse, starting at the bottom-right. Otherwise it scans from the top-left.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to get the tile from.

returns.help: The first (or n skipped) tile with the matching index.

public.help:
Searches the entire map layer for the first tile matching the given index, then returns that Phaser.Tile object.
If no match is found it returns null.
The search starts from the top-left tile and continues horizontally until it hits the end of the row, then it drops down to the next column.
If the reverse boolean is true, it scans starting from the bottom-right corner travelling up to the top-left.

class.help:
A Point object represents a location in a two-dimensional coordinate system, where x represents the horizontal axis and y represents the vertical axis.
The following code creates a point at (0,0):
`var myPoint = new Phaser.Point();`
You can also use them as 2D Vectors and you'll find different vector related methods in this class.

class.help:
Ninja Physics. The Ninja Physics system was created in Flash by Metanet Software and ported to JavaScript by Richard Davey.

It allows for AABB and Circle to Tile collision. Tiles can be any of 34 different types, including slopes, convex and concave shapes.

It does what it does very well, but is ripe for expansion and optimisation. Here are some features that I'd love to see the community add:

* AABB to AABB collision
* AABB to Circle collision
* AABB and Circle 'immovable' property support
* n-way collision, so an AABB/Circle could pass through a tile from below and land upon it.
* QuadTree or spatial grid for faster Body vs. Tile Group look-ups.
* Optimise the internal vector math and reduce the quantity of temporary vars created.
* Expand Gravity and Bounce to allow for separate x/y axis values.
* Support Bodies linked to Sprites that don't have anchor set to 0.5

Feel free to attempt any of the above and submit a Pull Request with your code! Be sure to include test cases proving they work.

parameters.name: game
parameters.help: reference to the current game instance.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to map.currentLayer.

public.help: Clears all physics bodies from the given TilemapLayer that were created with `World.convertTilemap`.

public.name: collide

parameters.name: object1
parameters.help: The first object to check. Can be an instance of Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Group, Phaser.Particles.Emitter, or Phaser.TilemapLayer.

parameters.name: object2
parameters.help: The second object or array of objects to check. Can be Phaser.Sprite, Phaser.Group, Phaser.Particles.Emitter or Phaser.TilemapLayer.

parameters.name: collideCallback
parameters.help: An optional callback function that is called if the objects collide. The two objects will be passed to this function in the same order in which you specified them.

parameters.name: processCallback
parameters.help: A callback function that lets you perform additional checks against the two objects if they overlap. If this is set then collision will only happen if processCallback returns true. The two objects will be passed to this function in the same order in which you specified them.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which to run the callbacks.

public.help:
Checks for collision between two game objects. You can perform Sprite vs. Sprite, Sprite vs. Group, Group vs. Group, Sprite vs. Tilemap Layer or Group vs. Tilemap Layer collisions.
The second parameter can be an array of objects, of differing types.
The objects are also automatically separated. If you don't require separation then use ArcadePhysics.overlap instead.
An optional processCallback can be provided. If given this function will be called when two sprites are found to be colliding. It is called before any separation takes place,
giving you the chance to perform additional checks. If the function returns true then the collision and separation is carried out. If it returns false it is skipped.
The collideCallback is an optional function that is only called if two sprites collide. If a processCallback has been set then it needs to return true for collideCallback to be called.

public.name: convertTilemap

parameters.name: map
parameters.help: The Tilemap to get the map data from.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to map.currentLayer.

parameters.name: slopeMap
parameters.help: The tilemap index to Tile ID map.

returns.help: An array of the Phaser.Physics.Ninja.Tile objects that were created.

public.help:
Goes through all tiles in the given Tilemap and TilemapLayer and converts those set to collide into physics tiles.
Only call this *after* you have specified all of the tiles you wish to collide with calls like Tilemap.setCollisionBetween, etc.
Every time you call this method it will destroy any previously created bodies and remove them from the world.
Therefore understand it's a very expensive operation and not to be done in a core game update loop.

In Ninja the Tiles have an ID from 0 to 33, where 0 is 'empty', 1 is a full tile, 2 is a 45-degree slope, etc. You can find the ID
list either at the very bottom of `Tile.js`, or in a handy visual reference in the `resources/Ninja Physics Debug Tiles` folder in the repository.
The slopeMap parameter is an array that controls how the indexes of the tiles in your tilemap data will map to the Ninja Tile IDs.
For example if you had 6 tiles in your tileset: Imagine the first 4 should be converted into fully solid Tiles and the other 2 are 45-degree slopes.
Your slopeMap array would look like this: `[ 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 3 ]`.
Where each element of the array is a tile in your tilemap and the resulting Ninja Tile it should create.

public.name: enableTile

parameters.name: object

parameters.name: id
parameters.help: The type of Tile this will use, i.e. Phaser.Physics.Ninja.Tile.SLOPE_45DEGpn, Phaser.Physics.Ninja.Tile.CONVEXpp, etc.

parameters.name: children
parameters.help: Should a body be created on all children of this object? If true it will recurse down the display list as far as it can go.

public.help:
This will create a Ninja Physics Tile body on the given game object. There are 34 different types of tile you can create, including 45 degree slopes,
convex and concave circles and more. The id parameter controls which Tile type is created, but you can also change it at run-time.
Note that for all degree based tile types they need to have an equal width and height. If the given object doesn't have equal width and height it will use the width.
A game object can only have 1 physics body active at any one time, and it can't be changed until the object is destroyed.

public.name: overlap

parameters.name: overlapCallback

parameters.name: processCallback
parameters.help: A callback function that lets you perform additional checks against the two objects if they overlap. If this is set then overlapCallback will only be called if processCallback returns true.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context in which to run the callbacks.

public.help:
Checks for overlaps between two game objects. The objects can be Sprites, Groups or Emitters.
You can perform Sprite vs. Sprite, Sprite vs. Group and Group vs. Group overlap checks.
Unlike collide the objects are NOT automatically separated or have any physics applied, they merely test for overlap results.
The second parameter can be an array of objects, of differing types.

public.name: alive
public.inlineHelp: A useful boolean to control if the Image is alive or dead (in terms of your gameplay, it doesn't effect rendering).

public.name: alpha
public.help: The opacity of the object.

public.name: anchor
public.help:
The anchor sets the origin point of the texture.
The default is 0,0 this means the texture's origin is the top left
Setting than anchor to 0.5,0.5 means the textures origin is centered
Setting the anchor to 1,1 would mean the textures origin points will be the bottom right corner

public.name: angle
public.inlineHelp: The angle of this Image in degrees.
public.help: Indicates the rotation of the Image, in degrees, from its original orientation. Values from 0 to 180 represent clockwise rotation; values from 0 to -180 represent counterclockwise rotation.\nValues outside this range are added to or subtracted from 360 to obtain a value within the range. For example, the statement player.angle = 450 is the same as player.angle = 90.\nIf you wish to work in radians instead of degrees use the property Image.rotation instead. Working in radians is also a little faster as it doesn't have to convert the angle.

public.name: animations
public.inlineHelp: This manages animations of the sprite. You can modify animations through it (see Phaser.AnimationManager)

public.name: autoCull
public.inlineHelp: A flag indicating if the Image should be automatically camera culled or not.
public.help: Should this Image be automatically culled if out of range of the camera?\nA culled sprite has its renderable property set to 'false'.\nBe advised this is quite an expensive operation, as it has to calculate the bounds of the object every frame, so only enable it if you really need it.

public.name: blendMode
public.help: The blend mode to be applied to the sprite. Set to PIXI.blendModes.NORMAL to remove any blend mode.

public.name: buttonMode
public.help: This is used to indicate if the displayObject should display a mouse hand cursor on rollover

public.name: cacheAsBitmap
public.help: Set if this display object is cached as a bitmap.\nThis basically takes a snap shot of the display object as it is at that moment. It can provide a performance benefit for complex static displayObjects.\nTo remove simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: cameraOffset
public.inlineHelp: If this object is fixedToCamera then this stores the x/y offset that its drawn at, from the top-left of the camera view.

public.name: children
public.help: [read-only] The array of children of this container.

public.name: cropRect
public.inlineHelp: The Rectangle used to crop the texture. Set this via Sprite.crop. Any time you modify this property directly you must call Sprite.updateCrop.

public.name: debug
public.inlineHelp: Handy flag to use with Game.enableStep

public.name: defaultCursor
public.help: This is the cursor that will be used when the mouse is over this object. To enable this the element must have interaction = true and buttonMode = true\n

public.name: deltaX
public.inlineHelp: The delta value. Positive if the motion was to the right, negative if to the left.
public.help: Returns the delta x value. The difference between world.x now and in the previous step.

public.name: deltaY
public.inlineHelp: The delta value. Positive if the motion was downwards, negative if upwards.
public.help: Returns the delta y value. The difference between world.y now and in the previous step.

public.name: deltaZ
public.inlineHelp: The delta value.
public.help: Returns the delta z value. The difference between rotation now and in the previous step.

public.name: destroyPhase
public.inlineHelp: True if this object is currently being destroyed.

public.name: events
public.inlineHelp: The Events you can subscribe to that are dispatched when certain things happen on this Image or its components.

public.name: exists
public.inlineHelp: If exists = false then the Image isn't updated by the core game loop.

public.name: filterArea
public.help: The area the filter is applied to like the hitArea this is used as more of an optimisation\nrather than figuring out the dimensions of the displayObject each frame you can set this rectangle

public.name: filters
public.help: Sets the filters for the displayObject.\n* IMPORTANT: This is a webGL only feature and will be ignored by the canvas renderer.\nTo remove filters simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: fixedToCamera
public.inlineHelp: Set to true to fix this Image to the Camera at its current world coordinates.
public.help: An Image that is fixed to the camera uses its x/y coordinates as offsets from the top left of the camera. These are stored in Image.cameraOffset.\nNote that the cameraOffset values are in addition to any parent in the display list.\nSo if this Image was in a Group that has x: 200, then this will be added to the cameraOffset.x

public.name: frame
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the current frame index and updates the Texture for display.

public.name: frameName
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the current frame by name and updates the Texture for display.

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the currently running Game.

public.name: height
public.help: The height of the sprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

public.name: hitArea
public.help: This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default.\nSetting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)

public.name: inCamera
public.inlineHelp: True if the Image bounds is within the game camera, even if only partially. Otherwise false if fully outside of it.
public.help: Checks if the Image bounds are within the game camera, otherwise false if fully outside of it.

public.name: inWorld
public.inlineHelp: True if the Image bounds is within the game world, even if only partially. Otherwise false if fully outside of it.
public.help: Checks if the Image bounds are within the game world, otherwise false if fully outside of it.

public.name: input
public.inlineHelp: The Input Handler for this object. Needs to be enabled with image.inputEnabled = true before you can use it.

public.name: inputEnabled
public.inlineHelp: Set to true to allow this object to receive input events.
public.help: By default an Image won't process any input events at all. By setting inputEnabled to true the Phaser.InputHandler is\nactivated for this object and it will then start to process click/touch events and more.

public.name: interactive
public.help: Indicates if the sprite will have touch and mouse interactivity. It is false by default

public.name: key
public.inlineHelp: This is the image or texture used by the Image during rendering. It can be a string which is a reference to the Cache entry, or an instance of a RenderTexture, BitmapData or PIXI.Texture.

public.name: mask
public.help: Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it.\nIn PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping.\nTo remove a mask, set this property to null.

public.name: name
public.inlineHelp: The user defined name given to this Image.

public.name: parent
public.help: [read-only] The display object container that contains this display object.

public.name: pivot
public.help: The pivot point of the displayObject that it rotates around

public.name: position
public.help: The coordinate of the object relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

public.name: renderOrderID
public.inlineHelp: The render order ID, reset every frame.

public.name: renderable
public.help: Can this object be rendered

public.name: rotation
public.help: The rotation of the object in radians.

public.name: scale
public.help: The scale factor of the object.

public.name: shader
public.help: The shader that will be used to render the texture to the stage. Set to null to remove a current shader.

public.name: smoothed
public.inlineHelp: Set to true to smooth the texture of this Image, or false to disable smoothing (great for pixel art)
public.help: Enable or disable texture smoothing for this Image. Only works for bitmap/image textures. Smoothing is enabled by default.

public.name: stage
public.help: [read-only] The stage the display object is connected to, or undefined if it is not connected to the stage.

public.name: texture
public.help: The texture that the sprite is using

public.name: tint
public.help: The tint applied to the sprite. This is a hex value. A value of 0xFFFFFF will remove any tint effect.

public.name: type
public.inlineHelp: The const type of this object.

public.name: visible
public.help: The visibility of the object.

public.name: width
public.help: The width of the sprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

public.name: world
public.inlineHelp: The world coordinates of this Image. This differs from the x/y coordinates which are relative to the Images container.

public.name: worldAlpha
public.help: [read-only] The multiplied alpha of the displayObject

public.name: worldVisible
public.help: [read-only] Indicates if the sprite is globally visible.

public.name: x
public.help: The position of the displayObject on the x axis relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

public.name: y
public.help: The position of the displayObject on the y axis relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

public.name: z
public.inlineHelp: The z-depth value of this object within its Group (remember the World is a Group as well). No two objects in a Group can have the same z value.

private.name: _cache
private.help:
A small internal cache:
0 = previous position.x
1 = previous position.y
2 = previous rotation
3 = renderID
4 = fresh? (0 = no, 1 = yes)
5 = outOfBoundsFired (0 = no, 1 = yes)
6 = exists (0 = no, 1 = yes)
7 = fixed to camera (0 = no, 1 = yes)
8 = destroy phase? (0 = no, 1 = yes)

class.help: An Image is a light-weight object you can use to display anything that doesn't need physics or animation.\nIt can still rotate, scale, crop and receive input events. This makes it perfect for logos, backgrounds, simple buttons and other non-Sprite graphics.

parameters.name: game
parameters.help: A reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: The x coordinate of the Image. The coordinate is relative to any parent container this Image may be in.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The y coordinate of the Image. The coordinate is relative to any parent container this Image may be in.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The texture used by the Image during rendering. It can be a string which is a reference to the Cache entry, or an instance of a RenderTexture, BitmapData or PIXI.Texture.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.help: If this Image is using part of a sprite sheet or texture atlas you can specify the exact frame to use by giving a string or numeric index.

public.name: bringToTop

returns.help: This instance.

public.help: Brings the Image to the top of the display list it is a child of. Images that are members of a Phaser.Group are only\nbought to the top of that Group, not the entire display list.

public.name: click
public.help: A callback that is used when the users clicks on the displayObject with their mouse's left button

public.name: crop

parameters.name: rect
parameters.help: The Rectangle used during cropping. Pass null or no parameters to clear a previously set crop rectangle.

parameters.name: copy
parameters.help: If false Sprite.cropRect will be a reference to the given rect. If true it will copy the rect values into a local Sprite.cropRect object.

public.help:
Crop allows you to crop the texture used to display this Image.
Cropping takes place from the top-left of the Image and can be modified in real-time by providing an updated rectangle object.
The rectangle object given to this method can be either a Phaser.Rectangle or any object so long as it has public x, y, width and height properties.
Please note that the rectangle object given is not duplicated by this method, but rather the Image uses a reference to the rectangle.
Keep this in mind if assigning a rectangle in a for-loop, or when cleaning up for garbage collection.

public.name: destroy

parameters.name: destroyChildren
parameters.help: Should every child of this object have its destroy method called?

public.help: Destroys the Image. This removes it from its parent group, destroys the input, event and animation handlers if present\nand nulls its reference to game, freeing it up for garbage collection.

public.name: kill

returns.help: This instance.

public.help:
Kills a Image. A killed Image has its alive, exists and visible properties all set to false.
It will dispatch the onKilled event, you can listen to Image.events.onKilled for the signal.
Note that killing a Image is a way for you to quickly recycle it in a Image pool, it doesn't free it up from memory.
If you don't need this Image any more you should call Image.destroy instead.

public.name: loadTexture

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: This is the image or texture used by the Image during rendering. It can be a string which is a reference to the Cache entry, or an instance of a RenderTexture, BitmapData or PIXI.Texture.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.help: If this Image is using part of a sprite sheet or texture atlas you can specify the exact frame to use by giving a string or numeric index.

public.help: Changes the Texture the Image is using entirely. The old texture is removed and the new one is referenced or fetched from the Cache.\nThis causes a WebGL texture update, so use sparingly or in low-intensity portions of your game.

public.name: align
public.inlineHelp: Alignment for multiline text ('left', 'center' or 'right'), does not affect single line text.

public.name: alpha
public.help: The opacity of the object.

public.name: anchor
public.help:
The anchor sets the origin point of the texture.
The default is 0,0 this means the texture's origin is the top left
Setting than anchor to 0.5,0.5 means the textures origin is centered
Setting the anchor to 1,1 would mean the textures origin points will be the bottom right corner

public.name: angle
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the angle of rotation in degrees.
public.help: Indicates the rotation of the Text, in degrees, from its original orientation. Values from 0 to 180 represent clockwise rotation; values from 0 to -180 represent counterclockwise rotation.\nValues outside this range are added to or subtracted from 360 to obtain a value within the range. For example, the statement player.angle = 450 is the same as player.angle = 90.\nIf you wish to work in radians instead of degrees use the property Sprite.rotation instead.

public.name: blendMode
public.help: The blend mode to be applied to the sprite. Set to PIXI.blendModes.NORMAL to remove any blend mode.

public.name: buttonMode
public.help: This is used to indicate if the displayObject should display a mouse hand cursor on rollover

public.name: cacheAsBitmap
public.help: Set if this display object is cached as a bitmap.\nThis basically takes a snap shot of the display object as it is at that moment. It can provide a performance benefit for complex static displayObjects.\nTo remove simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: cameraOffset
public.inlineHelp: If this object is fixedToCamera then this stores the x/y offset that its drawn at, from the top-left of the camera view.

public.name: canvas
public.help: The canvas element that everything is drawn to

public.name: children
public.help: [read-only] The array of children of this container.

public.name: colors
public.inlineHelp: An array of the color values as specified by `Text.addColor`.

public.name: context
public.help: The canvas 2d context that everything is drawn with

public.name: defaultCursor
public.help: This is the cursor that will be used when the mouse is over this object. To enable this the element must have interaction = true and buttonMode = true\n

public.name: destroyPhase
public.inlineHelp: True if this object is currently being destroyed.

public.name: events
public.inlineHelp: The Events you can subscribe to that are dispatched when certain things happen on this Sprite or its components.

public.name: exists
public.inlineHelp: If exists = false then the Text isn't updated by the core game loop.

public.name: fill
public.inlineHelp: A canvas fillstyle that will be used on the text eg 'red', '#00FF00'.

public.name: filterArea
public.help: The area the filter is applied to like the hitArea this is used as more of an optimisation\nrather than figuring out the dimensions of the displayObject each frame you can set this rectangle

public.name: filters
public.help: Sets the filters for the displayObject.\n* IMPORTANT: This is a webGL only feature and will be ignored by the canvas renderer.\nTo remove filters simply set this property to 'null'

public.name: fixedToCamera
public.inlineHelp: Set to true to fix this Text to the Camera at its current world coordinates.
public.help: An Text that is fixed to the camera uses its x/y coordinates as offsets from the top left of the camera. These are stored in Text.cameraOffset.\nNote that the cameraOffset values are in addition to any parent in the display list.\nSo if this Text was in a Group that has x: 200, then this will be added to the cameraOffset.x

public.name: font
public.inlineHelp: The font the text will be rendered in, i.e. 'Arial'. Must be loaded in the browser before use.

public.name: fontSize
public.inlineHelp: The size of the font in pixels.

public.name: fontWeight
public.inlineHelp: The weight of the font: 'normal', 'bold', 'italic'. You can combine settings too, such as 'bold italic'.

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the currently running Game.

public.name: height
public.help: The height of the Text, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

public.name: hitArea
public.help: This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default.\nSetting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)

public.name: input
public.inlineHelp: The Input Handler for this object. Needs to be enabled with image.inputEnabled = true before you can use it.

public.name: inputEnabled
public.inlineHelp: Set to true to allow this object to receive input events.
public.help: By default a Text object won't process any input events at all. By setting inputEnabled to true the Phaser.InputHandler is\nactivated for this object and it will then start to process click/touch events and more.

public.name: interactive
public.help: Indicates if the sprite will have touch and mouse interactivity. It is false by default

public.name: lineSpacing
public.inlineHelp: Additional spacing (in pixels) between each line of text if multi-line.

public.name: mask
public.help: Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it.\nIn PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping.\nTo remove a mask, set this property to null.

public.name: name
public.inlineHelp: The user defined name given to this object.

public.name: parent
public.help: [read-only] The display object container that contains this display object.

public.name: pivot
public.help: The pivot point of the displayObject that it rotates around

public.name: position
public.help: The coordinate of the object relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

public.name: renderable
public.help: Can this object be rendered

public.name: resolution
public.help: The resolution of the canvas.

public.name: rotation
public.help: The rotation of the object in radians.

public.name: scale
public.help: The scale factor of the object.

public.name: shader
public.help: The shader that will be used to render the texture to the stage. Set to null to remove a current shader.

public.name: shadowBlur
public.inlineHelp: The shadowBlur value. Make the shadow softer by applying a Gaussian blur to it. A number from 0 (no blur) up to approx. 10 (depending on scene).

public.name: shadowColor
public.inlineHelp: The color of the shadow, as given in CSS rgba format. Set the alpha component to 0 to disable the shadow.

public.name: shadowOffsetX
public.inlineHelp: The shadowOffsetX value in pixels. This is how far offset horizontally the shadow effect will be.

public.name: shadowOffsetY
public.inlineHelp: The shadowOffsetY value in pixels. This is how far offset vertically the shadow effect will be.

public.name: stage
public.help: [read-only] The stage the display object is connected to, or undefined if it is not connected to the stage.

public.name: stroke
public.inlineHelp: A canvas fillstyle that will be used on the text stroke eg 'blue', '#FCFF00'.

public.name: strokeThickness
public.inlineHelp: A number that represents the thickness of the stroke. Default is 0 (no stroke)

public.name: text
public.inlineHelp: The text string to be displayed by this Text object, taking into account the style settings.
public.help: The text string to be displayed by this Text object, taking into account the style settings.

public.name: texture
public.help: The texture that the sprite is using

public.name: tint
public.help: The tint applied to the sprite. This is a hex value. A value of 0xFFFFFF will remove any tint effect.

public.name: type
public.inlineHelp: The const type of this object.

public.name: visible
public.help: The visibility of the object.

public.name: width
public.help: The width of the Text, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

public.name: wordWrap
public.inlineHelp: Indicates if word wrap should be used.

public.name: wordWrapWidth
public.inlineHelp: The width at which text will wrap.

public.name: world
public.inlineHelp: The world coordinates of this Sprite. This differs from the x/y coordinates which are relative to the Sprites container.

public.name: worldAlpha
public.help: [read-only] The multiplied alpha of the displayObject

public.name: worldVisible
public.help: [read-only] Indicates if the sprite is globally visible.

public.name: x
public.help: The position of the displayObject on the x axis relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

public.name: y
public.help: The position of the displayObject on the y axis relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

public.name: z
public.inlineHelp: The z-depth value of this object within its Group (remember the World is a Group as well). No two objects in a Group can have the same z value.

private.name: _cache
private.help:
A small internal cache:
0 = previous position.x
1 = previous position.y
2 = previous rotation
3 = renderID
4 = fresh? (0 = no, 1 = yes)
5 = outOfBoundsFired (0 = no, 1 = yes)
6 = exists (0 = no, 1 = yes)
7 = fixed to camera (0 = no, 1 = yes)
8 = destroy phase? (0 = no, 1 = yes)

private.name: _charCount
private.inlineHelp: Internal character counter used by the text coloring.

private.name: lineSpacing
private.inlineHelp: Additional spacing (in pixels) between each line of text if multi-line.

class.help: Create a new `Text` object. This uses a local hidden Canvas object and renders the type into it. It then makes a texture from this for renderning to the view.\nBecause of this you can only display fonts that are currently loaded and available to the browser. It won't load the fonts for you.\nHere is a compatibility table showing the available default fonts across different mobile browsers: http://www.jordanm.co.uk/tinytype

parameters.help: X position of the new text object.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: Y position of the new text object.

parameters.name: text
parameters.help: The actual text that will be written.

parameters.name: style
parameters.help: The style object containing style attributes like font, font size ,
